- Over 2,700 megabytes (two gigabytes) of free storage
- Built-in Google search that instantly finds any message you want

- No large, annoying ads--just small text ads and related pages that are
  relevant to the content of your messages

out our new switch guide: http://mail.google.com/mail/help/switch/

From: <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: asianst@berkeley.edu
Subject: consulting about admission
Dear Professor,

My name is Yuan Gao, I am a fourth-year undergraduate in China,
majoring in Automobile Engineering. I have a strong wish to pursue an
M.A. degree in Asian Studies at U.C. Berkeley, because the
interdisciplinary nature of GAP with its valuable and powerful
resources really fascinates me.

I am proficient in both modern and ancient Chinese, and I can read a
little German and Japanese. Besides, I am interested in various areas
such as Art, Literature, Sociology, Political Science, Music(I study
and listen to a great measure of Chinese and Japanese music, both
traditional and avant-garde, and a great number of Indian classical
music too) and Buddism(I have been studying Buddism for a few years
and being a Buddist myself). I also believe that I have an aptitude
for culture study with great academic potential.

It is one of my concerns that the irrelevancy of my current major to
the Asian Studies would diminish my competitiveness when applying to
GAS. If this is true, would you please let me know if there was any
precedent of successful application similar to my case? Is there any
way, for example, a strong statement of purpose or sample of academic
writing, would help increase my competitiveness?

Best wishes,

Yuan, Gao



From: <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: CEAS-Admissions@stanford.edu
Subject: consulting about admission
Dear Professor,

My name is Yuan Gao, I am a fourth-year undergraduate in China,
majoring in Automobile Engineering. I have a strong wish to pursue an
M.A. degree in East Asian Studies at Stanford, because the
interdisciplinary nature of CEAS with its valuable and powerful
resources really fascinates me.

I am proficient in both modern and ancient Chinese, and I can read a
little German and Japanese. Besides, I am interested in various areas
such as Art, Literature, Sociology, Political Science, Music(I study
and listen to a great measure of Chinese and Japanese music, both
traditional and avant-garde) and Buddism(I have been studying Buddism
for a few years and being a Buddist myself). I also believe that I
have an aptitude for culture study with great academic potential.

It is one of my concerns that the irrelevancy of my current major to
the East Asian Studies would diminish my competitiveness when applying
to CEAS. If this is true, would you please let me know if there was
any precedent of successful application similar to my case? Is there
any way, for example, a strong statement of purpose or sample of
academic writing, would help increase my competitiveness?

Best wishes,

Yuan, Gao

From: <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: <trysoda@gmail.com>
Subject:
The important qualities of a good roomate



We become more independent and learn more life experience while live without
families, but your roommates. However, to live with other people is neither
easy nor difficult. You should learn how to be a good roommate, basically.



Believe or not, dormitory life is a extremly happy thing. You make new
friends, experience independece, difficulties and enjoy the freedom. But all
of these are base on your behaves as a good roommate.



Firstly, you should know how to respect people. Not only your roommate, also
people around you. It is the most important factor in our communications.
Whatever what is your background, you are the same as your roommates, you
guys are all equal. To respect your roommate, respect their religions and
cultures. Do not laugh at enthetic people or racism. That is rude and
stupid. We should respect what God created for us. Besides, you must respect
your roommates' privately, everyone have right to have their secrets.



Take your duty and responsibility. You can not ingore and think about those
are negligible. Do not tend to ask your mates to do things what you have to
do. Remember, no one will like a lazy and irresponsible roommate. In
general, you should help to cleaning, put litter bags to dustheap, put
things back after you used .To be quite when others are studying, take care
of your men is another factor among.



In addition, You are one of members of your dormitory. Do not hide yourself
behind, you are buddy of your roommates. Try to share your ideas, experience
of study and life, your happiness etc. And you listen to your mates
experience as well. Take care of your mates You dormitory will be lively
then.



All in all, as long as you enjoy your dormitory life, get well with your
friends, then you should be a good roommate. Whatever what you experiences,
those of them will be a beautiful memorial of your rest of life. TRY IT.

4th to January 2nd. While there are no set deadlines for the receipt of
letters of recommendation it is always best to have recommendations
submitted as early as possible so that they may be assoicated with the
application and the applicant notified that they have been submitted.

>

> -- Safari version 1.0 or higher for Mac OS X
> -- Mozilla/Firefox
>
> We do suggest using Safari on a Mac, which generally gives the best
results (since it was designed specifically for the Mac operating system).
All other browsers have been designed for a PC environment and have been
adapted to work with the Mac environment.
>
> You should disable any pop-up blocking software you may have installed on
your computer as these will preclude error and information messages from
being displayed.
>

m

accessed the Recommendation Form and experience difficulties please use the
"Need Help?" link at the top of any page as your first course of action.

closing your browser and re-opening it.  You may also find that a re-start
of your system will refresh it and resolves most anomalies.

From: Yuan Gao <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: craigslist 3756970154 <qbbgw-3756970154@hous.craigslist.org>
Subject: Re: sublet
Hi Johan,

Yes, I'm certainly able to move in the first of May.

I'd suggest that I book the room for May and June first, and let you know
if I could stay longer prior to mid June. Does that sound ok to you?

Let me briefly say something about myself. I graduated from EE Columbia
last year, worked a whole year in LA, and just moved back to New York, with
a plan to go to NYU on Sep. I seldom cook, most of the time eat out. I'm
quite, and clean. I don't drink. Highly respect others' privacy.

If it's ok with you, I hope I can go see the apartment tomorrow and if it's
good, I'll reserve the room.

Thanks.

&lt;p&gt;This yeaRoppongi Art Nighan annual all-nig=
ht outdoor art festival featuring installations and performances at various=
 locations in TokyRoppongi districtook place this w=
eekend. &lt;/p&gt;

ongi_art_night_2_large.jpg&quot;&gt;+&lt;/a&gt;]&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;The centerpiece of the festival waother Night=9D a 13-meter (43-ft) tall spaceship-like balloon sculpture by artist Nobo=
ru Tsubaki. Stationed at Roppongi Hills Arena, the imposing work monitored =
the carbon dioxide emissions of the onlookers and displayed real-time data =
on a built-in projection screen.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;But perhaps the most rousing event happened at the nearby Tokyo Mi=
dtown mega-complex, where French street theater troupe Compagnie des Quidam=
s performed their dreame erberpiec=
e, featuring larger-than-life bubble people with heads that glow.&lt;/p&gt;

Yuan Gao Mar 29, 2010
<a href="http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/shorpy/~3/66rzJzW6n7s/7945"><b>Wired: 1919</b></a> - <a href="http://www.shorpy.com" class="ot-origin-anchor">Shorpy Historic Photo Archive - Vintage Fine Art Prints</a>
&lt;img src=&quot;http://0-focus-opensocial.googleusercontent.com/gadgets/proxy?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.shorpy.com%2Ffiles%2Fimages%2F20545a.preview.jpg&amp;amp;container=focus&amp;amp;gadget=a&amp;amp;rewriteMime=image%2F*&amp;amp;refresh=31536000&quot; /&gt;&lt;div style=&quot;width:512px;margin-top:10px&quot;&gt;&lt;p&gt;Washington, D.C., circa 1919. &amp;quot;Chesapeake &amp;amp; Potomac Telephone Co. wiring.&amp;quot; A behind the scenes look at communications tech some 80 years after the telegraph tapped out its first message. Harris &amp;amp; Ewing glass negative. &lt;a href=&quot;http://www.shorpy.com/node/7945?size=_original&quot;&gt;View full size.&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;iframe src=&quot;http://feedads.g.doubleclick.net/~ah/f/a9c2unne0dqvvuu0bj514ftcmo/300/250#http%3A%2F%2Fwww.shorpy.com%2Fnode%2F7945&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; height=&quot;250&quot; frameborder=&quot;0&quot; scrolling=&quot;no&quot; marginwidth=&quot;0&quot; marginheight=&quot;0&quot;&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

From: Yuan Gao <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
Subject: Buzz from Yuan Gao
Yuan Gao - Google Reader Apr 23, 2010
Most creative protest ever: 50 cent bills rained on Yunnan's super censor W=
u Hao - Shanghaiist
It's raining cash on Yunnan propaganda official Wu Hao )=
 NetEase tells us of the most creative and harmonious protest we have ever =
seen in all our years here:April 22 -- This afternoon, Wu Hao ), the deputy director of the Yunnan arrived at the live recording st=
udio of the Renmin University to give a lecture. At 2pm, after the host of =
the event gave the audience an introduction of Wu Hao, Wu stepped on stage =
and proceeded to start with his presentation. But he had barely started wit=
h his lecture when a 25 year old youth went on stage, and threw a stack of =
50 cent bills at him, shouting, "Wu Hao! Wu mao!" [Editor's note: Wu mao me=
ans 50 cents in Chinese]. Later in the day, a Chengdu journalist managed to=
 get in touch with the young protestor, a Wang Zhongxia who says he is a Re=
nmin University graduate. Wang says in the morning, he went to the bank to =
exchange 30RMB worth of bills to "shower Wu Hao with respect". Subsequent a=
ttempts to get in touch with Wu Hao via phone calls and text messages went =
answered. [Translation by Shanghaiist]

Note: The term "50 Cent Party" , wumaodang] ref=
ers to paid internet commentators whose job is to post comments favourable =
to the government in order to skew public perception of policy. Word on the=
 street has it that each commentator is paid about 50 cents per post.



-----

Sugar island Cuba
You lay there just for fun
With all your colours and your pelts
A treasure in the sun

( 2 x )

Dabadabadabada
Dabadabadabada

Castro makes the poor man rich
And rings the rich man's nell
He makes the island grey and pale
I wish he were in hell

( 2 x )

Dabadabadabada
Dabadabadabada

Sugar island Cuba
You are no more for sale
This Castro makes the poor man rich
He makes the flowers pale

( 2 x )

Dabadabadabada

Subject: Re: photos
DJ,

Thanks!!! you ARE my man!!

I've been studying analog circuits and analog amps these days,
extremely exhausting and difficult for me. My life has been constrained fro=
m
every interesting events out there, including tonight's Budos Band live. I
can't even spare the time for the newly purchased Zero History(damn I wanna
read it so bad)! Hope I will be free for the poetry reading, so many big
names...

Wish you an extraordinary weekend.

On Sat, Sep 18, 2010 at 6:58 PM, Dajuin Yao <dajuin@gmail.com> wrote:

> GY,
>
> i've searched craigslist for you, but it seems there aint nothing
> there for good audio gear.
>
> best place to shop is still Ebay. Generally speaking, models after the
> 1980s and 90s are mostly shit for audio equipment, so 2nd hand is your
> best choice.
>
> i've searched and found this dream combo for you. Exactly fits your
> budget, and should take you directly to music itself~~!!
>
>
>
> Paradigm Studio 20 Reference Speakers, for $400. Exactly the same
> price that i bought them several years ago. Best best buy for this
> price. Unbeatable. I used them for mastering and studio audio work,
> not only music listening... they are that good.
>
>
>
> http://cgi.ebay.com/Paradigm-Reference-Studio-20-v2-Speakers-/23051691675=
1?pt=3DSpeakers_Subwoofers&hash=3Ditem35abe1020f
>
>
> Sansui vintage amp 9900 -- $550. This is the KING of vintage solid
> state amps, from the 1970s -- if you check vintage Sansui sites you'll
> know. I've heard similar in this series, they sound like tube amps,
> but are transistor amps. Powerful sound that you won't get from new
> gear nowadays. I used a lower end Sansui amp made around 1980 and it
> worked very well for me for years.
>
>
> http://cgi.ebay.com/SANSUI-AU-9900-INTEGRATED-AMPLIFIER-SANSUI-AU9900-NIC=
E-/280563210619?pt=3DLH_DefaultDomain_0&hash=3Ditem4152ded97b
>



--=20
Gol Ng=FBang, 2010

From: Yuan Gao <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: Dajuin Yao <dajuin@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: Please get this book
Dear DJ,

Happy new year!

Things been changing for me soon as the new year began. Lately I felt this
urge to stop nail-biting and cigarette smoking at all. Plus I've met a girl
not long ago that I kinda fell for, and we went to see the movie Her
tonight (highly recommended by Hollywood standards). 2014 might bring
something good for me, hopefully.

Glad to hear that you're enjoying some leisure after all the hardworking.
Miss you much.

As for myself, I've been planning with GX on a new social-networking
platform, highly motivated now to get it done in the next few months.
Firstly we need to find some engineers to put up a team on this side of
earth. Actually I'm going back to China on Wed this week for chinese new
year, will elaborate on the idea later :)

I will get the book now and have it shipped to my place (will get me a copy
also). GX can help me send it back to China. The Keith Jarrett - No End CD
I have sent out weeks ago should arrive at your place soon.

Cheers, and hope we have a chance to meet up during chinese new year.

GY

From: <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: Nova XUE <xuenova@gmail.com>
Subject: 
Dear Silicon Labs,



My name is Yuan Gao and I am a first year graduate student at Columbia
University, learning Electrical Engineering. I would like to apply for your
Electrical Engineering Summer Intern position.



I believe I am fit for the position because of my strong analytical skills,
my creativity, and my communications ability. Studying Automotive
Engineering in Tongji University, China, I was a challenge-seeker all the
time. I joined a Formula SAE project in Tongji University, with the purpose
of designing and building a small Formula-style race car, and actively
participated in its layout, assembly and testing process to see its birth.
In parallel with that project, I was also a member of the engineering
department of the 2015 PACE China's Concept Car Project(initiated by General
Motors), and was responsible for using CAX software to design, draw and
analyze different auto components, e.g. transmission components. Besides all
the engineering work, I also assisted my fellow members in the marketing
department to conduct market analysis and to come up with marketing
strategies, with the aim of gaining more insights into the business world
and the industry itself. The project went well and we managed to give a
successful presentation of the whole idea. Furthermore, in my senior year,
my broadened interest in Electrical Engineering led me to finish a more
electronic-wise graduation project, designing a simulation device for the
testing of the Battery Management System of vehicles. The project involved
design and simulation of the schematic, drawing the PCB, and debugging the
circuit board after it was made. With that challenging experience I decided
to devote myself for further study in Electrical Engineering, a choice
inherently corresponded to my adventurous nature.


Silicon Labs appeals to me because the diversity and pace of learning it can
offer is truly unique, with exposure to the cutting-edge technologies and a
wide range of industries and areas. I am looking for an environment where I
can constantly learn new things, maximize my potential, and have fun as
well. Most importantly, I am passionate about ICs as well as its audio
applications, and I find Silicon Labs, with strong background high
reputation in this filed, being the most suitable place for me to start my
career.



I believe with my passion, I would fit well in Arup.



Sincerely,


Yuan Gao

From: None
To: None
Subject: None
3.4
M3.8

n =3D 0:99;

x1 =3D cos(0.3*n);

x2 =3D cos(0.6*n);

x =3D x1+x2;

% computing the coefficients of the desired fliter

A =3D [2*cos(0.3) 1;2*cos(0.6) 1];

B =3D [1;0];

alpha =3D A\B;

h =3D [alpha(1) alpha(2) alpha(1)];

% verifying the filtering operation

y =3D filter(h,1,x);

plot(n,y,'r-',n,x1,'b--',n,x2,'g-.');

axis([0 100 -1.2 4]);

ylabel('Amplitude'); xlabel('Time index n');

legend('y[n]','x1[n]','x2[n]'6.

> Reply-To: Eran Fishler <eran.fishler@gmail.com>
>  Subject: Mid Term
>      To: Zc2204@columbia.edu, Alexander Foster <amf2191@columbia.edu>,
> Johnny Chin <cyc2106@columbia.edu>, jx2159@columbia.edu,
> yc2615@columbia.edu, apc2113@columbia.edu, Icream Wu <icream4236@gmail.co=
m>,
> Frank Fang <yf2231@columbia.edu>, ys2522@columbia.edu
>
> The mid term is going to be 90 minutes. It will be closed book and all
> formulas required for answering the questions, e.g., derivatives, etc wil=
l
> be supplied.
>
> There will be 4 questions that will cover all the material we learned so
> far. In particular:
> 1) Realization. You should know how to build a system given a transfer
> function.
> 2) fundamental and state transition matrix, you should know how to build
> them.
> 3) Controllability and observability: You should understand and be able t=
o
> check if a system is observable and controllable, what it means, the
> decomposition theorem we discussed in class, and the duality between
> controllable and observable systems.
> 4) be able to prove simple theorems.
>
> Please email me questions about the homework, and if you wish we can meet
> before the mid term. I will send solution for importent questions from th=
e
> homework tomorrow night.
>
> Eran
>
>
>
>
>
> ----- End forwarded message -----
>
>

Gol Nng, 2010

From: None
To: None
Subject: Non(a(b
M6.1 (a)

%Determin the factored form of G1(z), poles of G1(z), and plotting the

%pole-zero plot of G1(z)

num =3D [2 -5 13.48 -7.78 9];

den =3D [4 7.2 20 -0.8 8];

K =3D num(1)/den(1);

Numfactors =3D factorize(num);

Denfactors =3D factorize(den);

disp('Numerator factors'); disp(Numfactors);

disp('Denominator factors'); disp(Denfactors);

disp('Gain constant'); disp(K);

[r,p,k] =3D residuez(num,den);

disp('poles'); disp(p);

disp('magnitudes of poles'); disp(abs(p));

zplane(num,den);


M6.1 (b)

%Determine the factored form of G2(z), poles of G2(z), and plotting the

%pole-zero plot of G2(z)

num =3D [5 3.5 21.5 -4.6 18];

den =3D [5 15.5 31.7 22.52 4.8];

K =3D num(1)/den(1);

Numfactors =3D factorize(num);

Denfactors =3D factorize(den);

disp('Numerator factors'); disp(Numfactors);

disp('Denominator factors'); disp(Denfactors);

disp('Gain constant'); disp(K);

[r,p,k] =3D residuez(num,den);

disp('poles'); disp(p);

disp('magnitudes of poles'); disp(abs(p));

zplane(num,den);
--=20
Gol Nng, 2010

From: <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: nova_xue@126.com
Subject: 
Dear Silicon Labs,



My name is Yuan Gao and I am a first year graduate student at Columbia
University, learning Electrical Engineering. I would like to apply for your
Electrical Engineering Summer Intern position.



I believe I am fit for the position because of my strong analytical skills,
my creativity, and my communications ability. Studying Automotive
Engineering in Tongji University, China, I was a challenge-seeker all the
time. I joined a Formula SAE project in Tongji University, with the purpose
of designing and building a small Formula-style race car, and actively
participated in its layout, assembly and testing process to see its birth.
In parallel with that project, I was also a member of the engineering
department of the 2015 PACE China's Concept Car Project(initiated by General
Motors), and was responsible for using CAX software to design, draw and
analyze different auto components, e.g. transmission components. Besides all
the engineering work, I also assisted my fellow members in the marketing
department to conduct market analysis and to come up with marketing
strategies, with the aim of gaining more insights into the business world
and the industry itself. The project went well and we managed to give a
successful presentation of the whole idea. Furthermore, in my senior year,
my broadened interest in Electrical Engineering led me to finish a more
electronic-wise graduation project, designing a simulation device for the
testing of the Battery Management System of vehicles. The project involved
design and simulation of the schematic, drawing the PCB, and debugging the
circuit board after it was made. With that challenging experience I decided
to devote myself for further study in Electrical Engineering, a choice
inherently corresponded to my adventurous nature.


Silicon Labs appeals to me because the diversity and pace of learning it can
offer is truly unique, with exposure to the cutting-edge technologies and a
wide range of industries and areas. I am looking for an environment where I
can constantly learn new things, maximize my potential, and have fun as
well. Most importantly, I am passionate about ICs as well as its audio
applications, and I find Silicon Labs being the most suitable place for me
to start my career in this field.



I believe with my passion, I would fit well in Arup.



Sincerely,


Yuan Gao

From: None
To: None
Subject: None
M4.4


N =3D 3;

Fp =3D 1500;

Rp =3D 0.25;

Rs =3D 25;

% Determine the coefficients of the transfer function

[num,den] =3D ellip(N,Rp,Rs,2*pi*Fp,'s');

% Compute and plot the frequency response

omega =3D [0: 200: 24000*pi];

h =3D freqs(num,den,omega);

plot (omega/(2*pi),20*log10(abs(h)));

xlabel('Frequency, Hz'); ylabel('Gain, dB')
9.2
M9.

 so

From: quietboy.yuan@gmail.com
To: Eran Fishler <eran.fishler@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: Re: Exam
Professor,

About problem 3(e), I wonder is it actually the same question as 3(b)?

Thanks

On Dec 18, 2010 9:46am, Eran Fishler <eran.fishler@gmail.com> wrote:
> All,



> There is a small error in question 1(b) which makes the question

> somewhat not well defined. Please note that for 1(b) the function is

> x^(2)+\dot x^2(t) and not x^2(t) +\dot x(t). In particular, the

> derivative of x inside J has a square on it. Also the initial

> conditions are x(0)=0 and x(1)=1.



> Sorry for the inconvenience.



> Regards,



> Eran



> On Tue, Dec 14, 2010 at 8:47 PM, Eran Fishler eran.fishler@gmail.com>

> 100 points, so you should not worry, just try to do your best. Please  
> send me questions!

From: None
To: None

Dear MathWorks,



My name is Yuan Gao and I am a first year graduate student at Columbia
University, learning Electrical Engineering. I would like to apply for your
Application Support Engineer Intern position.



I believe I am fit for the position because of my strong analytical skills,
my creativity, and my communications ability. Studying Automotive
Engineering in Tongji University, China, I was a challenge-seeker all the
time. I joined a Formula SAE project in Tongji University, with the purpose
of designing and building a small Formula-style race car, and actively
participated in its layout, assembly and testing process to see its birth.
In parallel with that project, I was also a member of the engineering
department of the 2015 PACE China's Concept Car Project(initiated by Genera=
l
Motors), and was responsible for using CAX software to design, draw and
analyze different auto components, e.g. transmission components. Besides al=
l
the engineering work, I also assisted my fellow members in the marketing
department to conduct market analysis and to come up with marketing
strategies, with the aim of gaining more insights into the business world
and the industry itself. The project went well and we managed to give a
successful presentation of the whole idea. Furthermore, in my senior year,
my broadened interest in Electrical Engineering led me to finish a more
electronic-wise graduation project, designing a simulation device for the
testing of the Battery Management System of vehicles. The project involved
designing and simulation of the schematic, drawing the PCB, and debugging
the circuit board after it was made. With that challenging experience I
decided to devote myself for further study in Electrical Engineering, a
choice inherently corresponded to my adventurous nature.


MathWorks appeals to me because the diversity and pace of learning it can
offer is truly unique, with exposure to a wide range of industries and
areas. I am looking for an environment where I can constantly learn new
things, maximize my potential, and have fun as well. More importantly, I am
passionate about new concepts and practices in today's engineering world, a=
s
well as the realization of every creative thought. What attracts me most is
the fact that MathWorks provides the most essential tools and solutions for
every meaningful step in this world, forms a solid basis for its constant
development, and keeps influencing and changing the way people engineer. I
think MathWorks would be the best matrix for me to start my career.



I believe with my passion, I would fit well in MathWorks.



Sincerely,


Yuan Gao

From: None
To: None
Subject: None
3.2 (a)

num = ones(1,21);

den = [zeros(1,10),1];

k = 512;

w = 0:pi/(k-1):pi;

h = freqz(num, den, w);

% PLOT

subplot(2,2,1)

plot(w/pi,real(h));grid

title('Real part')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')

subplot(2,2,2)

plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid

title('Imaginary part')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')

subplot(2,2,3)

plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid

title('Magnitude Spectrum')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')

subplot(2,2,4)

plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid

title('Phase Spectrum')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')


3.2 (b)

num = [1, zeros(1,10), -1];

den = [1, -1];

k = 512;

w = 0:pi/(k-1):pi;

h = freqz(num, den, w);

% PLOT

subplot(2,2,1)

plot(w/pi,real(h));grid

title('Real part')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')

subplot(2,2,2)

plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid

title('Imaginary part')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')

subplot(2,2,3)

plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid

title('Magnitude Spectrum')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')

subplot(2,2,4)

plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid

title('Phase Spectrum')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')


3.2 (e)

N = 1:10;

EXP = exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);

num = [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];

den = [zeros(1,10), 2];

k = 512;

w = 0:pi/(k-1):pi;

h = freqz(num,den,w);

% PLOT

subplot(2,2,1)

plot(w/pi,real(h));grid

title('Real part')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')

subplot(2,2,2)

plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid

title('Imaginary part')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')

subplot(2,2,3)

plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid

title('Magnitude Spectrum')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')

subplot(2,2,4)

plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid

title('Phase Spectrum')

xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')


M5.2

A=input('input the first sequence = ');

B=input('input the second sequence = ');

L=length(A);

L2=length(B);

if L~=L2

    error('Sequences of unequal length');

end

m=1:L-1;

AK=zeros(1,L);

BK=zeros(1,L);

n=0;

for k=1:L

    DN=[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];

    AK(n+1)=DN*A.';

    BK(n+1)=DN*B.';

    n=n+1;

end

YK=AK.*BK;

n=0;

y=zeros(1,L);

for k=1:L

    DN=[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];

    y(n+1)=DN*YK.';

    n=n+1;

end

disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');

disp(y);

y1=ifft(YK);

disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');

disp(y1);


M5.3

% Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence

x = [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];

L = length(x);

X = fft(x);



% Relation 1

X1 = fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]

X2 = conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]

if X1==X2

    disp('Relation 1 verified');

else

    disp('error occured');

end



% Relation 2

X3 = fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]

X4 = conj(X);

if X3==X4

    disp('Relation 2 verified');

else

    disp('error occured');

end



% Relation 3

X5 = fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]

X6 = 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}

if abs(X5-X6)<=1E-10;

    disp('Relation 3 verified');

else

    disp('error occured');

end



% Relation 4

X7 = fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim

X8 = 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}

if X7==X8

    disp('Relation 4 verified');

else

    disp('error occured');

end



% Relation 5

X9 = fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]

X10 = real(X);

if X9==X10

    disp('Relation 5 verified');

else

    disp('error occured');

end



% Relation 6

X11 = fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]

X12 = 1i*imag(X);

if X11==X12

    disp('Relation 6 verified');

else

    disp('error occured');

end

> else

>> *From:[mailto:quietboy.yuan@gmail.com]
>> *Sent:* Tuesday, October 05, 2010 2:06 PM
>> *To:* Nova Xue
>> *Subject:>>
>>
>>
>> 3.2 (a)
>>
>>
>>
>> num =3D ones(1,21);
>>
>> den =3D [zeros(1,10),1];
>>
>> k =3D 512;
>>
>> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>>
>> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>>
>> % PLOT
>>
>> subplot(2,2,1)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>>
>> title('Real part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,2)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>>
>> title('Imaginary part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,3)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>>
>> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,4)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>>
>> title('Phase Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>>
>>
>>
>> 3.2 (b)
>>
>> num =3D [1, zeros(1,10), -1];
>>
>> den =3D [1, -1];
>>
>> k =3D 512;
>>
>> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>>
>> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>>
>> % PLOT
>>
>> subplot(2,2,1)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>>
>> title('Real part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,2)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>>
>> title('Imaginary part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,3)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>>
>> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,4)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>>
>> title('Phase Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>>
>>
>>
>> 3.2 (e)
>>
>> N =3D 1:10;
>>
>> EXP =3D exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);
>>
>> num =3D [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];
>>
>> den =3D [zeros(1,10), 2];
>>
>> k =3D 512;
>>
>> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>>
>> h =3D freqz(num,den,w);
>>
>> % PLOT
>>
>> subplot(2,2,1)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>>
>> title('Real part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,2)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>>
>> title('Imaginary part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,3)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>>
>> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,4)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>>
>> title('Phase Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>>
>>
>>
>> M5.2
>>
>> A=3Dinput('input the first sequence =3D ');
>>
>> B=3Dinput('input the second sequence =3D ');
>>
>> L=3Dlength(A);
>>
>> L2=3Dlength(B);
>>
>> if L~=3DL2
>>
>>     error('Sequences of unequal length');
>>
>> end
>>
>> m=3D1:L-1;
>>
>> AK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>>
>> BK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>>
>> n=3D0;
>>
>> for k=3D1:L
>>
>>     DN=3D[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];
>>
>>     AK(n+1)=3DDN*A.';
>>
>>     BK(n+1)=3DDN*B.';
>>
>>     n=3Dn+1;
>>
>> end
>>
>> YK=3DAK.*BK;
>>
>> n=3D0;
>>
>> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>>
>> for k=3D1:L
>>
>>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>>
>>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>>
>>     n=3Dn+1;
>>
>> end
>>
>> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>>
>> disp(y);
>>
>> y1=3Difft(YK);
>>
>> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>>
>> disp(y1);
>>
>>
>>
>> M5.3
>>
>> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>>
>> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>>
>> L =3D length(x);
>>
>> X =3D fft(x);
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 1
>>
>> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>>
>> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>>
>> if X2
>>
>>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 2
>>
>> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>>
>> X4 =3D conj(X);
>>
>> if X4
>>
>>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 3
>>
>> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>>
>> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>>
>> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>>
>>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 4
>>
>> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>>
>> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>>
>> if X8
>>
>>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 5
>>
>> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>>
>> X10 =3D real(X);
>>
>> if X10
>>
>>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 6
>>
>> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>>
>> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>>
>> if X112
>>
>>     disp('Relation 6 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>> This e-mail message, and any attachments, is intended only for the use o=
f
>> the individual or entity identified in the alias address of this message=
 and
>> may contain information that is confidential, privileged and subject to
>> legal restrictions and penalties regarding its unauthorized disclosure a=

> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (b)
>
> num =3D [1, zeros(1,10), -1];
>
> den =3D [1, -1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (e)
>
> N =3D 1:10;
>
> EXP =3D exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);
>
> num =3D [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10), 2];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num,den,w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> M5.2
>
> A=3Dinput('input the first sequence =3D ');
>
> B=3Dinput('input the second sequence =3D ');
>
> L=3Dlength(A);
>
> L2=3Dlength(B);
>
> if L~=3DL2
>
>     error('Sequences of unequal length');
>
> end
>
> m=3D1:L-1;
>
> AK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> BK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> n=3D0;
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];
>
>     AK(n+1)=3DDN*A.';
>
>     BK(n+1)=3DDN*B.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> YK=3DAK.*BK;
>
> n=3D0;
>
> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>
>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>
> disp(y);
>
> y1=3Difft(YK);
>
> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>
> disp(y1);
>
>
>
> M5.3
>
> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>
> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>
> L =3D length(x);
>
> X =3D fft(x);
>
>
>
> % Relation 1
>
> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>
> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>
> if X2
>
>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 2
>
> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>
> X4 =3D conj(X);
>
> if X4
>
>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 3
>
> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>
> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>
>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 4
>
> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>
> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if X8
>
>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 5
>
> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>
> X10 =3D real(X);
>
> if X10
>
>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 6
>
> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>
> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>
> if X112
>
>     disp('Relation 6 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>  This e-mail message, and any attachments, is intended only for the use o=
f
> the individual or entity identified in the alias address of this message =
and

> legal restrictions and penalties regarding its unauthorized disclosure an=
d

> *From:[mailto:quietboy.yuan@gmail.com]
> *Sent:* Tuesday, October 05, 2010 2:06 PM
> *To:* Nova Xue
> *Subject:>
>
>
> 3.2 (a)
>
>
>
> num =3D ones(1,21);
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10),1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (b)
>
> num =3D [1, zeros(1,10), -1];
>
> den =3D [1, -1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (e)
>
> N =3D 1:10;
>
> EXP =3D exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);
>
> num =3D [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10), 2];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num,den,w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> M5.2
>
> A=3Dinput('input the first sequence =3D ');
>
> B=3Dinput('input the second sequence =3D ');
>
> L=3Dlength(A);
>
> L2=3Dlength(B);
>
> if L~=3DL2
>
>     error('Sequences of unequal length');
>
> end
>
> m=3D1:L-1;
>
> AK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> BK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> n=3D0;
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];
>
>     AK(n+1)=3DDN*A.';
>
>     BK(n+1)=3DDN*B.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> YK=3DAK.*BK;
>
> n=3D0;
>
> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>
>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>
> disp(y);
>
> y1=3Difft(YK);
>
> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>
> disp(y1);
>
>
>
> M5.3
>
> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>
> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>
> L =3D length(x);
>
> X =3D fft(x);
>
>
>
> % Relation 1
>
> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>
> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>
> if X2
>
>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 2
>
> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>
> X4 =3D conj(X);
>
> if X4
>
>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 3
>
> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>
> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>
>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 4
>
> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>
> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if X8
>
>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 5
>
> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>
> X10 =3D real(X);
>
> if X10
>
>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 6
>
> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>
> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>
> if X112
>
>     disp('Relation 6 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>

>>
>> 3.2 (a)
>>
>>
>>
>> num =3D ones(1,21);
>>
>> den =3D [zeros(1,10),1];
>>
>> k =3D 512;
>>
>> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>>
>> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>>
>> % PLOT
>>
>> subplot(2,2,1)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>>
>> title('Real part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,2)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>>
>> title('Imaginary part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,3)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>>
>> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,4)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>>
>> title('Phase Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>>
>>
>>
>> 3.2 (b)
>>
>> num =3D [1, zeros(1,10), -1];
>>
>> den =3D [1, -1];
>>
>> k =3D 512;
>>
>> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>>
>> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>>
>> % PLOT
>>
>> subplot(2,2,1)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>>
>> title('Real part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,2)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>>
>> title('Imaginary part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,3)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>>
>> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,4)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>>
>> title('Phase Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>>
>>
>>
>> 3.2 (e)
>>
>> N =3D 1:10;
>>
>> EXP =3D exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);
>>
>> num =3D [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];
>>
>> den =3D [zeros(1,10), 2];
>>
>> k =3D 512;
>>
>> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>>
>> h =3D freqz(num,den,w);
>>
>> % PLOT
>>
>> subplot(2,2,1)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>>
>> title('Real part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,2)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>>
>> title('Imaginary part')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,3)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>>
>> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>>
>> subplot(2,2,4)
>>
>> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>>
>> title('Phase Spectrum')
>>
>> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>>
>>
>>
>> M5.2
>>
>> A=3Dinput('input the first sequence =3D ');
>>
>> B=3Dinput('input the second sequence =3D ');
>>
>> L=3Dlength(A);
>>
>> L2=3Dlength(B);
>>
>> if L~=3DL2
>>
>>     error('Sequences of unequal length');
>>
>> end
>>
>> m=3D1:L-1;
>>
>> AK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>>
>> BK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>>
>> n=3D0;
>>
>> for k=3D1:L
>>
>>     DN=3D[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];
>>
>>     AK(n+1)=3DDN*A.';
>>
>>     BK(n+1)=3DDN*B.';
>>
>>     n=3Dn+1;
>>
>> end
>>
>> YK=3DAK.*BK;
>>
>> n=3D0;
>>
>> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>>
>> for k=3D1:L
>>
>>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>>
>>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>>
>>     n=3Dn+1;
>>
>> end
>>
>> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>>
>> disp(y);
>>
>> y1=3Difft(YK);
>>
>> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>>
>> disp(y1);
>>
>>
>>
>> M5.3
>>
>> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>>
>> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>>
>> L =3D length(x);
>>
>> X =3D fft(x);
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 1
>>
>> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>>
>> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>>
>> if X2
>>
>>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 2
>>
>> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>>
>> X4 =3D conj(X);
>>
>> if X4
>>
>>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 3
>>
>> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>>
>> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>>
>> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>>
>>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 4
>>
>> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>>
>> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>>
>> if X8
>>
>>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 5
>>
>> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>>
>> X10 =3D real(X);
>>
>> if X10
>>
>>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>>
>> else
>>
>>     disp('error occured');
>>
>> end
>>
>>
>>
>> % Relation 6
>>
>> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>>
>> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>>
>> if X112
>>
>>     disp('Relation 6 verified');

> *From:[mailto:quietboy.yuan@gmail.com]
> *Sent:* Tuesday, October 05, 2010 2:06 PM
> *To:* Nova Xue
> *Subject:>
>
>
> 3.2 (a)
>
>
>
> num =3D ones(1,21);
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10),1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (b)
>
> num =3D [1, zeros(1,10), -1];
>
> den =3D [1, -1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (e)
>
> N =3D 1:10;
>
> EXP =3D exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);
>
> num =3D [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10), 2];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num,den,w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> M5.2
>
> A=3Dinput('input the first sequence =3D ');
>
> B=3Dinput('input the second sequence =3D ');
>
> L=3Dlength(A);
>
> L2=3Dlength(B);
>
> if L~=3DL2
>
>     error('Sequences of unequal length');
>
> end
>
> m=3D1:L-1;
>
> AK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> BK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> n=3D0;
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];
>
>     AK(n+1)=3DDN*A.';
>
>     BK(n+1)=3DDN*B.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> YK=3DAK.*BK;
>
> n=3D0;
>
> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>
>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>
> disp(y);
>
> y1=3Difft(YK);
>
> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>
> disp(y1);
>
>
>
> M5.3
>
> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>
> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>
> L =3D length(x);
>
> X =3D fft(x);
>
>
>
> % Relation 1
>
> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>
> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>
> if X2
>
>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 2
>
> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>
> X4 =3D conj(X);
>
> if X4
>
>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 3
>
> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>
> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>
>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 4
>
> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>
> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if X8
>
>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 5
>
> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>
> X10 =3D real(X);
>
> if X10
>
>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 6
>
> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>
> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>
> if X112
>
>     disp('Relation 6 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>

> *From:[mailto:quietboy.yuan@gmail.com]
> *Sent:* Tuesday, October 05, 2010 2:06 PM
> *To:* Nova Xue
> *Subject:>
>
>
> 3.2 (a)
>
>
>
> num =3D ones(1,21);
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10),1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (b)
>
> num =3D [1, zeros(1,10), -1];
>
> den =3D [1, -1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (e)
>
> N =3D 1:10;
>
> EXP =3D exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);
>
> num =3D [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10), 2];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num,den,w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> M5.2
>
> A=3Dinput('input the first sequence =3D ');
>
> B=3Dinput('input the second sequence =3D ');
>
> L=3Dlength(A);
>
> L2=3Dlength(B);
>
> if L~=3DL2
>
>     error('Sequences of unequal length');
>
> end
>
> m=3D1:L-1;
>
> AK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> BK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> n=3D0;
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];
>
>     AK(n+1)=3DDN*A.';
>
>     BK(n+1)=3DDN*B.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> YK=3DAK.*BK;
>
> n=3D0;
>
> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>
>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>
> disp(y);
>
> y1=3Difft(YK);
>
> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>
> disp(y1);
>
>
>
> M5.3
>
> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>
> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>
> L =3D length(x);
>
> X =3D fft(x);
>
>
>
> % Relation 1
>
> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>
> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>
> if X2
>
>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 2
>
> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>
> X4 =3D conj(X);
>
> if X4
>
>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 3
>
> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>
> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>
>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 4
>
> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>
> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if X8
>
>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 5
>
> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>
> X10 =3D real(X);
>
> if X10
>
>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 6
>
> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>
> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>
> if X112
>
>     disp('Relation 6 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>

> n=3D0;
>
> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>
>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>
> disp(y);
>
> y1=3Difft(YK);
>
> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>
> disp(y1);
>
>
>
> M5.3
>
> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>
> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>
> L =3D length(x);
>
> X =3D fft(x);
>
>
>
> % Relation 1
>
> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>
> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>
> if X2
>
>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 2
>
> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>
> X4 =3D conj(X);
>
> if X4
>
>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 3
>
> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>
> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>
>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 4
>
> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>
> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if X8
>
>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 5
>
> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>
> X10 =3D real(X);
>
> if X10
>
>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 6
>
> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>
> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>
> if X112
>
>     disp('Relation 6 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>

> *From:[mailto:quietboy.yuan@gmail.com]

>
>
> 3.2 (a)
>
>
>
> num =3D ones(1,21);
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10),1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (b)
>
> num =3D [1, zeros(1,10), -1];
>
> den =3D [1, -1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (e)
>
> N =3D 1:10;
>
> EXP =3D exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);
>
> num =3D [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10), 2];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num,den,w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> M5.2
>
> A=3Dinput('input the first sequence =3D ');
>
> B=3Dinput('input the second sequence =3D ');
>
> L=3Dlength(A);
>
> L2=3Dlength(B);
>
> if L~=3DL2
>
>     error('Sequences of unequal length');
>
> end
>
> m=3D1:L-1;
>
> AK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> BK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> n=3D0;
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];
>
>     AK(n+1)=3DDN*A.';
>
>     BK(n+1)=3DDN*B.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> YK=3DAK.*BK;
>
> n=3D0;
>
> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>
>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>
> disp(y);
>
> y1=3Difft(YK);
>
> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>
> disp(y1);
>
>
>
> M5.3
>
> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>
> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>
> L =3D length(x);
>
> X =3D fft(x);
>
>
>
> % Relation 1
>
> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>
> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>
> if X2
>
>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 2
>
> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>
> X4 =3D conj(X);
>
> if X4
>
>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 3
>
> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>
> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>
>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 4
>
> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>
> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if X8
>
>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 5
>
> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>
> X10 =3D real(X);
>
> if X10
>
>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 6
>
> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>
> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>
> if X112
>
>     disp('Relation 6 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end

> *From:[mailto:quietboy.yuan@gmail.com]

>
>
> 3.2 (a)
>
>
>
> num =3D ones(1,21);
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10),1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (b)
>
> num =3D [1, zeros(1,10), -1];
>
> den =3D [1, -1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (e)
>
> N =3D 1:10;
>
> EXP =3D exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);
>
> num =3D [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10), 2];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num,den,w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> M5.2
>
> A=3Dinput('input the first sequence =3D ');
>
> B=3Dinput('input the second sequence =3D ');
>
> L=3Dlength(A);
>
> L2=3Dlength(B);
>
> if L~=3DL2
>
>     error('Sequences of unequal length');
>
> end
>
> m=3D1:L-1;
>
> AK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> BK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> n=3D0;
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];
>
>     AK(n+1)=3DDN*A.';
>
>     BK(n+1)=3DDN*B.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> YK=3DAK.*BK;
>
> n=3D0;
>
> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>
>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>
> disp(y);
>
> y1=3Difft(YK);
>
> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>
> disp(y1);
>
>
>
> M5.3
>
> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>
> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>
> L =3D length(x);
>
> X =3D fft(x);
>
>
>
> % Relation 1
>
> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>
> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>
> if X2
>
>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 2
>
> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>
> X4 =3D conj(X);
>
> if X4
>
>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 3
>
> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>
> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>
>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 4
>
> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>
> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if X8
>
>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 5
>
> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>
> X10 =3D real(X);
>
> if X10
>
>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 6
>
> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>
> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>
> if X112
>
>     disp('Relation 6 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>

> *From:[mailto:quietboy.yuan@gmail.com]

> *To:* Nova Xue

>
>
> 3.2 (a)
>
>
>
> num =3D ones(1,21);
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10),1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (b)
>
> num =3D [1, zeros(1,10), -1];
>
> den =3D [1, -1];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num, den, w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> 3.2 (e)
>
> N =3D 1:10;
>
> EXP =3D exp(-1i*pi*N/20)+exp(1i*pi*N/20);
>
> num =3D [EXP(10:-1:1), 2, EXP(1:10)];
>
> den =3D [zeros(1,10), 2];
>
> k =3D 512;
>
> w =3D 0:pi/(k-1):pi;
>
> h =3D freqz(num,den,w);
>
> % PLOT
>
> subplot(2,2,1)
>
> plot(w/pi,real(h));grid
>
> title('Real part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,2)
>
> plot(w/pi,imag(h));grid
>
> title('Imaginary part')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Amplitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,3)
>
> plot(w/pi,abs(h));grid
>
> title('Magnitude Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Magnitude')
>
> subplot(2,2,4)
>
> plot(w/pi,angle(h));grid
>
> title('Phase Spectrum')
>
> xlabel('\omega/\pi'); ylabel('Phase, radians')
>
>
>
> M5.2
>
> A=3Dinput('input the first sequence =3D ');
>
> B=3Dinput('input the second sequence =3D ');
>
> L=3Dlength(A);
>
> L2=3Dlength(B);
>
> if L~=3DL2
>
>     error('Sequences of unequal length');
>
> end
>
> m=3D1:L-1;
>
> AK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> BK=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> n=3D0;
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1,exp(-1i*2*pi*m*n/L)];
>
>     AK(n+1)=3DDN*A.';
>
>     BK(n+1)=3DDN*B.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> YK=3DAK.*BK;
>
> n=3D0;
>
> y=3Dzeros(1,L);
>
> for k=3D1:L
>
>     DN=3D[1/L,exp(1i*2*pi*m*n/L)/L];
>
>     y(n+1)=3DDN*YK.';
>
>     n=3Dn+1;
>
> end
>
> disp('the circular convolution using DFT-based method is');
>
> disp(y);
>
> y1=3Difft(YK);
>
> disp('the circular convolution using ifft is');
>
> disp(y1);
>
>
>
> M5.3
>
> % Let x[n] be an arbitrary complex sequence
>
> x =3D [1-1i, 2+2*1i, 3-3*1i, 9+7*1i, 8-6*1i];
>
> L =3D length(x);
>
> X =3D fft(x);
>
>
>
> % Relation 1
>
> X1 =3D fft(conj(x)); % DFT of x*[n]
>
> X2 =3D conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)]); % X*[<-k>N]
>
> if X2
>
>     disp('Relation 1 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 2
>
> X3 =3D fft(conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)])); % DFT of x*[<-n>N]
>
> X4 =3D conj(X);
>
> if X4
>
>     disp('Relation 2 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 3
>
> X5 =3D fft(real(x)); % DFT of xre[n]
>
> X6 =3D 0.5*(X+conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xcs[k]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if abs(X5-X6)<=3D1E-10;
>
>     disp('Relation 3 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 4
>
> X7 =3D fft(1i*imag(x)); % DFT of jxim
>
> X8 =3D 0.5*(X-conj([X(1), X(L:-1:2)])); % Xca[s]=3D1/2{X[k]+X*[<-k>N]}
>
> if X8
>
>     disp('Relation 4 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 5
>
> X9 =3D fft(0.5*(x+conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xcs[n]
>
> X10 =3D real(X);
>
> if X10
>
>     disp('Relation 5 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>
>
>
> % Relation 6
>
> X11 =3D fft(0.5*(x-conj([x(1), x(L:-1:2)]))); % DFT of xca[n]
>
> X12 =3D 1i*imag(X);
>
> if X112
>
>     disp('Relation 6 verified');
>
> else
>
>     disp('error occured');
>
> end
>

From: None
To: None
Subject: None
3.7.7
7.1.1
M7.12

alpha=3D0.5095;

beta=3D-0.3090;

K=3D0.7548;

num=3D[K -2*K*beta K];

den=3D[1 -beta*(1+alpha) alpha];

w=3D0:pi/1023:pi;

H=3Dfreqz(num,den,w);

h=3Dabs(H);

plot(w/pi,h,'b-');

xlabel('Magnitude'); ylabel('\omega/\pi'); grid7_1

From: <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: Nova Xue <nxue@glgroup.com>
Subject: Re: resume
Dear Arup,



My name is Yuan Gao and I am a first year graduate student at Columbia
University, learning Electrical Engineering. I would like to apply for your
Electrical Engineering Summer Intern position.



I believe I am fit for the position because of my strong analytical skills,
my creativity, and my communications ability. Studying Automotive
Engineering in Tongji University, China, I was a challenge-seeker all the
time. I joined a Formula SAE project in Tongji University, with the purpose
of designing and building a small Formula-style race car, and actively
participated in its layout, assembly and testing process to see its birth.
In parallel with that project, I was also a member of the engineering
department of the 2015 PACE China's Concept Car Project(initiated by Genera=
l
Motors), and was responsible for using CAX software to design, draw and
analyze different auto components, e.g. transmission components. Besides al=
l
the engineering work, I also assisted my fellow members in the marketing
department to conduct market analysis and to come up with marketing
strategies, with the aim of gaining more insights into the business world
and the industry itself. The project went well and we managed to give a
successful presentation of the whole idea. Furthermore, in my senior year,
my broadened interest in Electrical Engineering led me to finish a more
electronic-wise graduation project, designing a simulation device for the
testing of the Battery Management System of vehicles. The project involved
design and simulation of the schematic, drawing the PCB, and debugging the
circuit board after it was made. With that challenging experience I decided
to devote myself for further study in Electrical Engineering, a choice
inherently corresponded to my adventurous nature.


Arup appeals to me because the diversity and pace of learning it can offer
is truly unique, with exposure to a wide range of industries and clients. I
am looking for an environment where I can constantly learn new things,
maximize my potential, and have fun as well. More importantly, there's a
part of me that is extremely passionate about Acoustics, Acoustical
Engineering and Acoustic Ecology, such fields that explore the intricate
delicacy of the relationship between sound, environment and space. What
attracts me most is that, among the many multi-dimensional projects of Arup=
,
Acoustical Consulting is exactly one of the business areas of yours. I find
this a rare chance and Arup being the most suitable place for me to start a
career in this field.



I believe with my passion, I would fit well in Arup.



Sincerely,


Yuan Gao

2010/10/14 Nova Xue <nxue@glgroup.com>

From: LambApe <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: marsyas-users@lists.sourceforge.net
Subject: MIREX2010
Hello all,

I'm trying to reproduce the result of the "MIREX 2010 Audio Tag Classification" with CAL500 dataset, following the instructions from the "README_2010.txt". There's some problems that confuse me.

First, in the readme file it says "assumes train.txt is a training list file (files and tags)...". My train.txt has the following pattern:

../../audio/CAL500/xxx1.mp3 tag1 tag2 tag3...
../../audio/CAL500/xxx2.mp3 tag2 tag4 tag6...
.
.
../../audio/CAL500/xxx500.mp3 tagxx tagxx...

is it the right way to construct this train.txt file?

Second, after training and prediction through kea, I got a stage1_affinities.txt file. However, after the "> ../../scripts/Ruby/threshold_binarization.rb train.txt stage1_affinities.txt > stage1_predictions.txt" step I only got a blank "stage1_predictions" file. Can anyone tell me what the problem is?

Best,
LA



From: LambApe <quietboy.yuan@gmail.com>
To: marsyas-users@lists.sourceforge.net
Subject: MIREX2010
Hello all,

I'm trying to reproduce the result of the "MIREX 2010 Audio Tag Classification" with CAL500 dataset, following the instructions from the "README_2010.txt". There's some problems that confuse me.

First, in the readme file it says "assumes train.txt is a training list file (files and tags)...". My train.txt has the following pattern:

../../audio/CAL500/xxx1.mp3 tag1 tag2 tag3...
../../audio/CAL500/xxx2.mp3 tag2 tag4 tag6...
.
.
../../audio/CAL500/xxx500.mp3 tagxx tagxx...

is it the right way to construct this train.txt file?

Second, after training and prediction through kea, I got a stage1_affinities.txt file. However, after the "> ../../scripts/Ruby/threshold_binarization.rb train.txt stage1_affinities.txt > stage1_predictions.txt" step I only got a blank "stage1_predictions" file. Can anyone tell me what the problem is?

Best,
LA
