On Friday, January 22, 2016, Dan Wilcox <danomatika@gmail.com> wrote:

> Howdy all,
>
> pleased to announce that the PdParty BETA has started!
>
> After almost two months of work, there have been quite a number of
> improvements and I feel the app is now close to version 1.0 status.
>
> I just need your help to find bugs, suggest improvements, and create demo
> scenes.
>
> *How this works*
>
> 1. Send me your name & email*
>
> 2. I add you to the tester list
>
> 3. You should receive a notification email
>
> 4. Download the free TestFlight app form the App Store
>
> 5. Open TestFlight and install the latest PdParty build
>
> *Those of you who participated in the alpha testing should already have
> received an email.
>
> *Info*
>
> PdParty User Guide
> <https://github.com/danomatika/PdParty/blob/master/doc/guide/PdParty_User=
_Guide.md>
>
> PdParty Composer Pack
> <http://docs.danomatika.com/PdParty_composerpack.zip>
>
> Happy Patching!
>
> --------
> Dan Wilcox
> @danomatika <https://twitter.com/danomatika>
> danomatika.com
> robotcowboy.com
>
>

From: Hudson Animal Hospital PLLC <hudsonahnyc@yahoo.com>
Date: Tue, Feb 2, 2016 at 5:43 PM
Subject: Re: Diet for Lucky
To: Yuen Ko <821760408.sp@gmail.com>


Hello!

1.  Yes - measuring cup (8oz cup) will do!

2.   You may have to offer her a little less than 1/4 cup twice a day with
Orijen since a greenie is usually about 30 to 40 kcal/treat!

3.  Let's do both - Greenie and brushing teeth.

Hope this helps!

Dr. Yoshida

*Hudson Animal Hospital*
*238 W 61st Street*
*New York, NY 10023*
*212-706-4088 <212-706-4088>*
http://hudsonahnyc.com
Facebook <http://facebook.com/hudsonanimalhospitalnyc>
Twitter <http://twitter.com/hudsonanimalhos>



On Tuesday, February 2, 2016 5:09 PM, Yuen Ko <821760408.sp@gmail.com>
wrote:


Hello Dr. Yoshida

Thank you so much for your advice. I only have a few petty questions:

1, When we say "cup", is it the same as the measure "cup" that we use in
human cooking?

2, We'd like to change to a different brand for Lucky, however we
still have some Orijen left. Would you say ok if we feed Lucky 1/4 cup each
meal, a total of 1/2 cup per day that is 250 Cal/day? We can even reduce it
to less than 1/4 cup per meal, so there's still room for treat.

3, Would you recommend using GREENIE (which is of course
extra calories), or just brush his teeth instead?

Best,
Gao

On Monday, February 1, 2016, Hudson Animal Hospital PLLC <
hudsonahnyc@yahoo.com> wrote:

It was nice meeting you and Lucky today!

So to summerize, we want Lucky to only eat 250 kcal/day.
Orijen diet has 480 to 500 kcal/cup.
I looked for other food and here are the food that my work better for him.

Eukanuba small breed weight control 310 kcal/cup
Solid Gold Fit and Fabulous 330 kcal/cup.

With these food, you may feed him 2/3 cup a day and about 30 -40 kcal worth
of treats a day!

Please weigh him monthly, if you don't see any improvement after 3 months,
please notify me.

Dr. Yoshida

MY name is Yuan Gao (BP#928611). I rented a monthly parking space on Nov 15
at the MP 41 LL, 475 W 41st St, my parking number being #44. Yest=
erday I
received an invoice of $350 whose due date was Dec 1, and I have some
questions about it:

Firstly, my starting date with MPS was on Nov 15, and I've already paid a
monthly fee of $350 in advance. Shouldn't I be billed on the starting date
of the next period, Dec 15, instead of Dec 1, only half a month after I
paid the first time?

Secondly, I was going to apply for Manhattan resident parking tax exemption
prior to my second monthly payment, which I thought was on Dec 15, and that
should reduce my tax.

Please let me know why I am billed again only half a month after the first
payment, and whether my applying to tax exemption will lead to a lower
second payment.

Best regards,

Yuan Gao

From: Yuen Ko <821760408.sp@gmail.com>
To: trysoda@qq.com
Subject: THE CONVERSATION - NOTES
HEY,

HERE'S THE LINK TO THE FIRST BATCH OF VIDEOS:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/u159a1lpftn7kwk/AADeKWrJv8pY0-14vr_sYd4ia?dl=0


THE LOGIC IS SIMPLE: WE'RE CREATING A CONVERSATION BETWEEN TWO BOTS IN THE
CHARACTERS WE ASSIGN THEM, USING FOOTAGES OF THE CORRESPONDING
PERSONALITIES THAT WE GATHERED.

SOME SUGGESTED TREATMENTS OF THE VIDEOS:
- CUT THE PERSONS'S SPEECHES INTO COHERENT AND COMPLETE SENTENCES, AS MANY
AS POSSIBLE; THESE WILL BE USED AS RAW MATERIALS LATER.
(IF YOU'RE TECHNICALLY LIMITED TO DO SO, MARK THE TIMES WHERE EACH SENTENCE
STARTS AND ENDS.)
- ATTACH A TRANSCRIPTION TO EACH OF THE SENTENCES.
- GATHER MORE MATERIALS IF POSSIBLE.

>     -- Tip

> etc.
>     -- Disassembling of Pool Table, any Exercise Machine and Bunk Bed
>     -- Disconnect any appliance (ex: TV, lamp), furniture(ex: wall unit,
> Buddha table ), decoration (painting, photo etc. ) *from ceiling, wall or
> floor *(No construction work)
>     -- Boxes packing and unpacking
>     -- Disposal unwanted furniture ( Bring to go )
>
> * The moving is served with a spring cargo van.
> * All light bulb must be taken out from the lamps, which are going to be
> moved, before moving.
> * Extra moving item will cost additional charge.

> information below,

> City

  *Claim in Process*
Dear Yuan,

Thank you for sending us your pet insurance claim for Lucky.

To complete your claim, we need your help by providing us with the
following documentation:


   - All of Lucky's medical records since joining your family (view
   <http://t.sidekickopen50.com/e1t/c/5/f18dQhb0S7lC8dDMPbW2n0x6l2B9nMJN7t5=
XX4QZxxqW1q0NZC2zhzGHW2z8P1C56dL1bf1pRCkv02?t=3Dhttps%3A%2F%2Fservices.heal=
thypawspetinsurance.com%2FDocuments%2FGet%3Fid%3DMR&si=3D4827641952862208&p=
i=3D230efe07-80c2-4a73-ade4-f8cdd64fdc45>
   an example medical record). Your veterinary hospital will provide these
   documents to you and many are happy to send them on your behalf.

You or your veterinary hospital can fax or e-mail this information to us at
888-228-4129 or claims@healthypawspetinsurance.com. Once we receive this
information we will finish processing your claim.

If you have questions, you can call us at 855-898-8991 or email us at
claims@healthypawspetinsurance.com. We are available Monday-Friday from 6
a.m. to 6 p.m. and Saturday-Sunday 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Pacific Time.

Warmest regards,
Lara
Healthy Paws Customer Care

>> // This example shows how to read an analog
>> // value from an serial port
>> // and draw circle with size mapped to that value
>>
>> // Declare a "SerialPort" object
>> var serial;
>> var lastState =3D 0;
>> var theQuote =3D "";
>> var lastQuote =3D "nolastquote";
>> // Variable for size
>> var switchState =3D 0;
>>
>> var quote =3D ["I am at peace with my sexuality.",
>>     "The Ocean of Life is lavish with its abundance. All my needs and
>> desires are met before I even ask. My good comes from everywhere and
>> everyone and everything.",
>>     "Stop focusing on what you do not have, and shift your consciousness
>> to an appreciation for all that you are and all that you do have.",
>>     "Your joy is divine, and so is your suffering. Therso mu=
ch to be
>> learned from both.",
>>     "Appreciation acknowledges the value of the road I have traveled. It
>> recognizes the courage and commitment it takes to create lasting change.=
",
>>     "My body heals itself with every breath I take.",
>>     "If you think an unloving thought or a thought devoid of love, such
>> as competition, envy, or worry, you feel pain. Ask your angels to help y=
ou
>> hold only loving thoughts.",
>>     "You awaken to your own perfection through your desire to see the
>> perfection in someone else.",
>>     "The world changes when we change. The world softens when we soften.
>> The world loves us when we choose to love the world.",
>>     "I am beautiful. I am bountiful. I am bliss.",
>>     "Happiness is my birthright. I embrace happiness as my set point
>> state of being.",
>>     "I feel joy and contentment in this moment right now.",
>>     "I awaken in the morning feeling happy and enthusiastic about life."=
,
>>     "I can tap into a wellspring of inner happiness anytime I wish",
>>     "By allowing myself to be happy, I inspire others to be happy as
>> well.",

>>     "I look at the world around me and cahelp but smile and =
feel
>> joy.",
>>     "I find joy and pleasure in the most simple things in life.",
>>     "I have an active sense of humor and love to share laughter with

>> world",
>>     "You are not alone.",
>>     "Make love to yourself.",
>>     "I expect to be successful in all of my endeavors. Success is my
>> natural state.",
>>     "I easily find solutions to challenges and roadblocks and move past
>> them quickly.",
>>     "Mistakes and setbacks are stepping stones to my success because I
>> learn from them.",
>>     "Every day in every way, I am becoming more and more successful.",
>>     "I feel successful with my life right now, even as I work toward
>> future success.",
>>     "I know exactly what I need to do to achieve success.",
>>     "I see fear as the fuel for my success and take bold action in spite
>> of fear.",
>>     "I feel powerful, capable, confident, energetic, and on top of the
>> world.",
>>     "I have an intention for success and know it is a reality awaiting m=
y
>> arrival.",
>>     "Today I am successful. Tomorrow I will be successful. Every day I a=
m
>> successful."
>>   ];
>>
>> function setup() {
>>   createCanvas(displayWidth, displayHeight);
>>
>>   // Instantiate our SerialPort object
>>   serial =3D new p5.SerialPort();
>>
>>   // Assuming our Arduino is connected, let's open the connection to it
>>   // Change this to the name of your arduino's serial port
>>   serial.open("/dev/tty.usbmodemfd121");
>>
>>   // if you need to see the list
>>    //serial.onList(gotList);
>>
>>   // This is a new concept!
>>   // Whenever there is new data, the "gotData" function happens.
>>   // This is called a *CALLBACK*
>>   serial.onData(gotData);
>> }
>>
>> // This happens when there is data
>> function gotData() {
>>   // Read the data as text (a string)!
>>   var data =3D serial.readLine();
>>   // Check to make sure something really came in
>>   if (data.length > 0) {
>>     // Get the 0 or 1
>>     switchState =3D Number(data);
>>   }
>> }
>>
>>  function draw() {
>>   background(255, 182, 193);
>> if (switchState > 0 && lastStat0) {
>>   textAlign(CENTER, CENTER);
>>   textSize(25);
>>   while (theQuotlastQuote) {
>>     theQuote =3D quote[floor(random(30))];
>>   }
>>   text(theQuote, width / 2, height / 4, width / 50, height / 2);
>>   lastState =3D switchState;
>>   lastQuote =3D theQuote;
>> } else if (switchState > 0 && lastState > 0) {
>>   textAlign(CENTER, CENTER);
>>   textSize(25);
>>   text(theQuote, width / 2, height / 4, width / 50, height / 2);
>> } else {
>>   lastState =3D 0;
>> }
>> // } else if (switchStat) {
>> //   background(255, 182, 193);
>> // }
>> }
>>
>> // function draw() {
>>
>> //   // Do something based on whether
>> //   // switch is on or off!
>> //   if (switchStat0) {
>> //     background(255, 182, 193);
>> //     fill(255);
>> //     textFont("Script")
>> //     textAlign(CENTER, CENTER);
>> //     textSize(25);
>> //     fill(255, 0, 0);
>> //     text('YOU ARE NOT ALONE YOU ARE NOT ALONE YOU ARE NOT YOU ARE
>> NOT', width / 2, height / 4, width / 50, height / 2);
>>
>> //   } else if (switchStat1) {
>> //     background(255);
>> //     fill(0);
>> //     textAlign(CENTER, CENTER);
>> //     textSize(24);
>> //     text('ON', width / 2, height / -2);
>> //   }
>> // }
>>
>>

From: Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu>

Subject: Re: [Health.Center #83666] trouble accessing Health History Form

On Tue, Jul 7, 2015 at 2:03 PM, Sarah Fousse via RT <health.center@nyu.edu>
wrote:

> Dear Yuan,
>
> thank you for your email. The Student Health History form is a
> self-reporting questionnaire and will be available online once you are
> matriculated in your program.
>
> For general information and guidelines on the health requirements please
> visit our website at
>
>
> http://www.nyu.edu/life/safety-health-wellness/student-health-center/records-forms-policies/health-requirements.html
>
> If you have separate documentation of your 2 MMR vaccine dates, you can
> fax those to the Immunization Records Services Department to 212-443-1198.
> You do not need to fill out the immunization form if you are submitting
> separate documentation.
>
> Please note: Any separate documentation must be signed and or stamped by a
> clinic or clinician
>
> Separate documentation may include the following:
>
> A baby vaccination record book of your 2 MMR vaccine dates (Measles, Mumps
> and Rubella) (Signed and stamped)
>
> A medical certificate from your family doctor (signed and stamped)
>
> A lab report (titers), indicating that you are immune to Measles, Mumps
> and Rubella. (Signed and stamped)
>
> Please make sure to include your N# on any documentation you are faxing.
>
> If you are a graduate student you have the option of opting out of the
> meningitis vaccine, to do so please complete the meningitis response form.
>
> The Meningitis form can be found:
>
> www.nyu.edu/health/meningitis-response-form
>
> Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or concerns.
> Kind regards,
> Sarah
>
>
> On Tue Jul 07 13:27:05 2015, yg1349@nyu.edu wrote:

Sorry I was too sick the past few days to reply. What I was referring to in
my midterm rant was actually something to be found in the ancient Chinese
literature about the acoustics and psychoacoustics of sound, as well as
some near-past acoustic technologies (some mentioned in Joseph
Needham's Science and Civilisation in China). But now I think that might be
more suitable for a final project of the class. So I'm going to edit my
midterm paragraph and focus on some self-made hydrophone and underwater
recordings.

From: Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu>
To: tisch.gradadmissions@nyu.edu
Subject: Inquiry about change of status from H1B to F1
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am a new international student for the Fall semester in Tisch ITP. My id#
is N15764129. Here is my question:

I am currently working on H1B visa in the US, but am going to end my
contract with my company before the Fall semester begins. I have filed a
Form I-539 to USCIS for a Change of Status from H1B to F1 without leaving
the country, and they have received it on Apr. 28, 2015. However, after 3
months have passed I still haven't heard from USCIS. I'd want to know that,
in the worst-case scenario, is it possible for me to register as a
full-time student for the Fall semester, provided that my Change of Status
is still pending with USCIS by then? And also, what are the
implications/consequences if I were to terminate my H1B status with my
company before September, but hasn't received approval on Change of Status
by then?

Sincerely,

Yuan Gao

From: None
To: None
Subject: None
On Sun, Oct 4, 2015 at 7:47 PM, Yuan Xue <yuan.xue@nyu.edu> wrote:

> function Circle(){
>   this.x = width/2;
>   this.y = height;
>   this.dia = random(2, 8);
>   this.xspeed = 0;
>   this.yspeed = -11;
>   this.isBoomed = false;
>   this.startAngle = random(0, PI*2);
>   this.boomVel = random(-2.0, 2.0);
>   this.boomAmp = random(6);
>
>
>   this.move = function(){
>     if(this.isBoomed){
>   this.x = this.x + this.xspeed + sin(this.startAngle +
> frameCount*this.boomVel)*this.boomAmp;
>   this.y += this.yspeed + cos(this.startAngle +
> frameCount*this.boomVel)*this.boomAmp;
>     } else {
>   this.x = this.x + this.xspeed;
>   this.y += this.yspeed;
>     }
>
>   this.yspeed = this.yspeed + 0.1;
>   if (frameCount == 120 || frameCount == 190 || frameCount == 250){
>     this.boom();
>   }
>  }
>   this.boom = function(){
>      this.xspeed = random(-5, 5);
>      this.yspeed = random(-5, 2);
>      this.isBoomed = true;
>   }
>
>   this.display = function(){
>   fill(255, 210, 140, 150);
>   ellipse(this.x, this.y, this.dia, this.dia);
>  }
> }
>
> var lights = [];
>
> function setup() {
>   createCanvas(500,700);
>   noStroke();
>   //blendMode(ADD);
>   for (var i=0; i< 300 ; i++){
>   lights.push ( new Circle() );
>   }
> }
>
> function draw() {
>   background(0,10);
>
>   push();
>   blendMode(ADD);
>   for (var i=0; i< lights.length ; i++){
>   lights[i].move();
>   lights[i].display();
>   }
>   pop();
>
>   fill(255);
>   text(frameCount, 10, 20);
> }
>
> function keyPressed(){
>   for (var i=0; i< lights.length ; i++){
>   lights[i].boom();
>   }
> }
>
>

>>>>> Hey Everyone,
>>>>>
>>>>> Quick recap of our meeting.  The plan is to put together a quick
>>>>> presentation where we talk about each speaker (spend about 10 seconds per
>>>>> speaker to make sure we don't take up too much time), as well as quickly
>>>>> recap all the stuff we learned that people never imagined they could have
>>>>> learned (javascript, p5, arduino, fabrication, video, animation, and
>>>>> whatever else).  The presentation should take less than 10 minutes so we
>>>>> have time for the activity.
>>>>>
>>>>> For our activity - everyone will get a piece of paper with a prompt on
>>>>> it asking them to reflect on their first semester and, with their new found
>>>>> skills as well as everything we heard in Applications, what questions they
>>>>> want to answer going forward.  We'll also give everyone an envelope.  After
>>>>> 5 minutes of writing their response, we'll ask them to put it in the
>>>>> envelope, seal it up, and we'll mail it back to them at the start of our
>>>>> second year at ITP.
>>>>>

>>>>>>> found skills as well as everything we heard in Applications, what questions

>>>>>>> After 5 minutes of writing their response, we'll ask them to put it in the

>>>>>>> second year at ITP.

>> Hey Everyone,
>>
>> Quick recap of our meeting.  The plan is to put together a quick
>> presentation where we talk about each speaker (spend about 10 seconds per
>> speaker to make sure we don't take up too much time), as well as quickly
>> recap all the stuff we learned that people never imagined they could have
>> learned (javascript, p5, arduino, fabrication, video, animation, and
>> whatever else).  The presentation should take less than 10 minutes so we
>> have time for the activity.
>>
>> For our activity - everyone will get a piece of paper with a prompt on it
>> asking them to reflect on their first semester and, with their new found
>> skills as well as everything we heard in Applications, what questions they
>> want to answer going forward.  We'll also give everyone an envelope.  After
>> 5 minutes of writing their response, we'll ask them to put it in the
>> envelope, seal it up, and we'll mail it back to them at the start of our
>> second year at ITP.

>>>> Hey Everyone,
>>>>
>>>> Quick recap of our meeting.  The plan is to put together a quick
>>>> presentation where we talk about each speaker (spend about 10 seconds per
>>>> speaker to make sure we don't take up too much time), as well as quickly
>>>> recap all the stuff we learned that people never imagined they could have
>>>> learned (javascript, p5, arduino, fabrication, video, animation, and
>>>> whatever else).  The presentation should take less than 10 minutes so we
>>>> have time for the activity.
>>>>
>>>> For our activity - everyone will get a piece of paper with a prompt on
>>>> it asking them to reflect on their first semester and, with their new found
>>>> skills as well as everything we heard in Applications, what questions they
>>>> want to answer going forward.  We'll also give everyone an envelope.  After
>>>> 5 minutes of writing their response, we'll ask them to put it in the
>>>> envelope, seal it up, and we'll mail it back to them at the start of our
>>>> second year at ITP.
>>>>
>>>> *Breakdown of speakers:*
>>>> *Chelsea:*
>>>> Majora Carter
>>>> Mitu Khandaker-Kokoris
>>>> Dennis Crowley
>>>>
>>>> *Jamie:*
>>>> David Sassoon
>>>> Sigi Moeslinger
>>>> Nicholas Negroponte
>>>>
>>>> *Yuan:*
>>>> Carter Emmart
>>>> Ken Perlin
>>>> Ethan Zuckerman
>>>>
>>>> *Jess:*
>>>> Anna Deavere Smith
>>>> Robert Krulwich
>>>> Kenyatta Cheese
>>>>
>>>> Jess will create a google presentation and share it with all of us so
>>>> we can have our slides in one place.
>>>>
>>>> Thanks everyone!
>>>> Jamie

Subject: need approval for joining Body Electric
Hello Conor,

My name is Yuan Gao (student id yg1349), currently having my 2nd
semester in ITP. I just discovered your course Body Electric and
instantly fell in love with it. I have been planning on a new project
that involves lucid dream-inducing and -interacting techniques, and
your course seems like a perfect site for it to happen.

I have a master's in Electrical Engineering but right now want to make
a transition to art, while at the same time keeping my feet wet with
electronics/software. Right now I'm envisioning a lot of possible
forms for my project, including smart-phone/watch/web app,
audio/visual work in MaxMSPJitter/Processing/openFrameworks, and/or
physical installation, with the help of various sensors being taught
in your class.

I have successfully enrolled in the course and hope you'll approve my
enrollment. Although I have missed the first class, I'll try to make
it up by asking my classmates who's in the class and learn about the
materials I missed.

Best,
Yuan

On Fri, Feb 5, 2016 at 1:33 PM, Jeff Feddersen <jfeddersen@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> I really enjoyed class yesterday - thank you! It was quite different than
> I had planned, but I think that's fine. I'm thinking about how to put as
> much hands-on time up front in class as necessary to get everyone
> comfortable with the electronics, while still preserving the chance to talk
> "big picture" stuff.
>
> To that end, here's a short a short questionnaire to get a better sense of
> everyone's experience level and what topics are of interest. It's not a
> test! No one is born knowing electronics: any detail you can provide there
> will help me calibrate the time in class:
>
>
> https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1onB1kUwcUuECp7hy9gSE-dnbulM7a65zjcK-rX9QcKI/viewform
>
> Also, I feel like it would be good to do a workshop Monday 2/8 reviewing
> motors/rectifiers/capacitors. I'll be on the floor in the morning for
> thesis advisement and would like to do it after that - around 2:30 or 3. Is
> anyone is interested/available at that time?
>
> As for other office hours, I've generally found that a recurring weekly
> slot is underutilized, and have had better luck scheduling times to
> meet/skype/call/chat/email/whatever at students' requests. That said, as
> I'll be on the floor Mondays for thesis students, early Monday afternoons
> will be a good time to meet in person, as will before or after the Thursday
> class.
>
> Attached are the schematics and a photo of the final board in class.
> (These will be posted on the week-by-week syllabus as well.)
>
>
>
> [image: Inline image 1][image: Inline image 2]
>
> Finally, the weird/good book on intuitive electronics is this one:
>
> http://www.amazon.com/There-Are-Electrons-Electronics-Earthlings/dp/0962781592
> As to why capacitance decreases when capacitors are in series: its harder
> for the Greenies to hear the music because there's more walls/distance
> between them and the party (or in "traditional" language, capacitance
> decreases with increasing distance between plates)
>
> !
>
> -jf-

meeting-with-instructor week) cycle, so next week there's will be no
class but to meet with the assigned instructor to talk about their
ideas for assignment.

>> report to the OGS.  The OGS must then activate your F-1 status in SEVIS.
>>
>> Please come to the OGS during Advisor Walk-in hours immediately with your
>> approval notice.  Please check the OGS webpage for walk-in hour schedule and
>> special closures.

>> reply immediately to let us know so that we may otherwise maintain your
>> pending F-1 record while you wait.

>> >> OGS records indicate you received an I-20 so that you could apply for a
>> >> change to F-1 status within the US, and that this change of status has
>> been
>> >> approved by USCIS.  Please note:  once you receive your F-1 approval
>> notice
>> >> from USCIS, you are required by the US Department of Homeland Security
>> to
>> >> report to the OGS.  The OGS must then activate your F-1 status in
>> SEVIS.
>> >>
>> >> Please come to the OGS during Advisor Walk-in hours immediately with
>> your
>> >> approval notice.  Please check the OGS webpage for walk-in hour
>> schedule and
>> >> special closures.
>> >>
>> >> If you have not yet received your F-1 approval notice from USCIS,
>> please
>> >> reply immediately to let us know so that we may otherwise maintain your
>> >> pending F-1 record while you wait.
>> >>
>> >> Best Wishes,

From: None
To: None
Subject: None
*Title*:

Satisfaction of Vibration (provisional)

*Description*:

A repetitive documentation of me singing/humming in the bathroom while 
brushing my teeth with electronic toothbrush.

The documentation is divided into two parts:

   - A sound recording of the scene(s)/process devoid of visual elements, 
   and 
   - A video documentation of the same without soundtrack

The two parts can be shown either side by side or separately.

--

From: None
To: None
Subject: None
*antiorp*, a.k.a. *Netochka Nezvanova*, a.k.a.* the *definitive anonymous artist/programmer/hacker 
of the 90s, in my opinion, whose true identit(ies) remained a mystery till 
this day.

The fact that he/she/they refuse to self-expose all along for so many 
years, to the point of having been forgotten/neglected at large, feels 
really powerful, pure, and deep to me.

On Tuesday, February 23, 2016, Tal Golan <tal@theouternets.com> wrote:

> Hi Yuan,
>
> Please contact the projector suppliers.
> The sales person I was in touch with, Colin Ho (colin.ho@szflyin.com
> <javascript:_e(%7B%7D,'cvml','colin.ho@szflyin.com');>), did not get back
> to me for a few days.
> I would suggest contacting him and other manufactures asking for:
> A laser projector 10K ANSI Lumens minimum, HD resolution.
> Please ask them to send specs of the different options and costs for
> sample unit, and for the unit cost in bulk orders (what would be the
> minimum order?).
>
> It can also be helpful if you find out about projection film
> manufacturers, there are so many sales representatives online and it might
> be better, for the long run, to find the manufacturers directly.
> Our original search was for the 3 layers solution, adding the third color
> layer to be pealed off after the sticker is placed on the window. - I'm
> attaching an image that might help explain that. In the picture the
> transparent layer is pealed off to reveal the adhesive side to be placed on
> the window, and then a green layer to be pealed off the non adhesive side.[image:
> Inline image 1]
> As we already discussed it can be interesting to find a film that shows
> the projection on both sides of the film (rear and front), as an
> alternative solution.
>
> If you will find something interesting we can order a sample.
>
>
> Please write to me with any question.
>
> Thank you,
> Tal
>
>
>
> Tal Golan
> The Outernets
> 433 Broadway
> New York, NY 10013
> 347.981.0515

On Thu, Jan 21, 2016 at 7:59 PM, lauren mccarthy <laurmccarthy@gmail.com> wrote:
> Hi everyone,
>
> I'm very excited about our Performing User class. This first assignment is
> due in class on the first day (1/27). It shouldn't be too difficult.
>
> Our first topic is about user instructions. I would like you each to spend
> some time looking at instructions or guides for using various technologies.
> This might mean a setup guide for your Nest thermostat, steps for creating
> an online account, an advice column about how to use social media, assembly
> instructions for Ikea furniture, etc. Think broadly about the terms
> "technology" and "instructions".
>
> Choose two that are most interesting to you and reply to this email with a
> link, picture, or screenshot of each before the start of class next week. We
> will discuss in class.
>
> Please let me know if you have any questions. Enjoy your last week of break!
>
> Best,
> Lauren
>
> --
> lauren mccarthy
> lauren-mccarthy.com

From: Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu>
To: Jesse Ricke <jesse@culturehub.org>
Subject: Re: Next Thursday?
Hi Jesse,

Sorry for the delayed reply. I need to talk to you about this.

Last week I checked with the Global Student Office of NYU, and they
said I couldn't use school credit for any internship during this
semester, because international student who's on student visa cannot
work during their first year in school. So starting from this week I
ended up having to take 5 classes for this semester, without having
any available credit slot for internship.

To be frankly the workload has been pretty heavy for me, and my wife
is also complaining about me not spending enough time at home. The
opportunity to work with CultureHub is really exciting, but I'm really
afraid that extra workload will make me stressed out. In light of the
situation, I think I might not be working any internship job this
semester.

Sorry for not being able to inform you earlier, and it's really
unfortunate for me not able to work on such an invigorating project. I
hope everything goes well with your project.

Best,

Yuan

From: lauren mccarthy <laurmccarthy@gmail.com>
Date: Sun, Jan 3, 2016 at 12:56 PM
Subject: january performance festivals
To: Aaron Montoya-Moraga <amm1252@nyu.edu>, Chang Liu <cl3387@nyu.edu>,
Chino Kim <dk1158@nyu.edu>, Chino Kim <chino@nyu.edu>, Jonathan James
Gallagher <jjg519@nyu.edu>, Matt Romein <mjr619@nyu.edu>, Matt Romein <
matt.romein@gmail.com>, Matthew Kaney <msk613@nyu.edu>, Naoki Ishizuka <
ni476@nyu.edu>, Nicola Carpeggiani <nc1768@nyu.edu>, Ravyn L Whitley <
rlw395@nyu.edu>, Serena M Parr <smp694@nyu.edu>, Serena M Parr <
serena.parr@gmail.com>, Shir David <sd2788@nyu.edu>, Shir David <
shirdavid@nyu.edu>, Skylar A Jessen <saj408@nyu.edu>, Wangshu Sun <
ws1108@nyu.edu>, Wangshu Sun <wangshu.sun@hotmail.com>, Yuan Gao <
yg1349@nyu.edu>


Hi, happy new year!

I'm excited about our performance class this spring, but before then, I
wanted to let you know about some performance happenings in NYC this month.
I am really bummed because I'm out of town, but there is a lot of great,
weird, interesting stuff, I hope you have a chance to check some of it out.

There are four festivals going on that include a mix of performance art,
theater, dance, and music -- American Realness <http://americanrealness.com=
>,
COIL Festival <http://www.ps122.org/coil-2016/>, Under the Radar Festival
<http://publictheater.org/en/Programs--Events/Under-the-Radar-Festival/>,
and Gray Spaces
<http://contemporaryperformance.com/sfx/portfolio/gray-spaces-2/>.

They all have various performances worth checking out, some may resonate
with you more than others. If I were in town, I would want to see these
ones:

   - Angela Washko, Tightrope Routines
   <http://contemporaryperformance.com/sfx/portfolio/3-tightrope-routines-a=
-feminist-artist-interviews-the-internets-most-infamous-misogynist/>
(Gray
   Spaces)
   - Jack Ferver, MON, MA, MES (REVISI)
   <http://americanrealness.com/portfolio-type/jack-ferver-5/> (American
   Realness)
   - Annie Dorsen, Yesterday Tomorrow
   <http://www.ps122.org/yesterday-tomorrow/?gclid=3DCJLZh_qSjsoCFQ9afgodXn=
QJPQ>
    (COIL)
   - Royal Osiris Karaoke Ensemble, Art of Luv
   <http://publictheater.org/Tickets/Calendar/PlayDetailsCollection/UTR/201=
6/Art-of-Luv/>
(Under
   the Radar)
   - M. Lamar, Destruction
   <http://americanrealness.com/portfolio-type/m-lamar/> (American Realness=
)
   - Mette Ingvartsen, 69 Positions
   <http://americanrealness.com/portfolio-type/mette-ingvartsen/> (American
   Realness)
   - Panoply Performance Laboratory (PPL), Embarrassed of the Whole #15
   <http://contemporaryperformance.com/sfx/portfolio/7-embarrassed-of-the-w=
hole-15/>
(Gray
   Spaces)
   - Jillian P, Panopticon <http://www.ps122.org/panopticon/> (COIL=
)
   - Toshiki Okada, God Bless Baseball
   <http://publictheater.org/Tickets/Calendar/PlayDetailsCollection/UTR/201=
6/God-Bless-Baseball/>
(Under
   the Radar) - read an interview with him here
   <http://www.nytimes.com/2014/05/25/theater/the-playwright-toshiki-okada-=
finds-an-audience-in-the-us.html>
   .

These are just a few, this article
<http://www.villagevoice.com/arts/in-the-nyc-theater-world-january-is-festi=
val-month-8083226>
describes some other highlights, and there's a lot more you may want to
just browse the festival sites.

I hope you find something that moves, confuses, or intrigues you. If you
end up seeing any, I'd love to hear your thoughts in the first class.

Enjoy your break!
Lauren


--=20
lauren mccarthy
lauren-mccarthy.com
@laurmccarthy <http://twitter.com/laurmccarthy>

> about details:

> strongly objects, let me know, otherwise I will update the syllabus
> accordingly tomorrow.
>
> Last, but important: Please collect your solar bots form the bot cage in
> the lobby. Ben will be using the area for his next class on Tuesday. If
> you're the last person to grab a bot, please email me so I know that's
> finished.
>
> Thanks again!
>
> -jf-
>

<http://www.spectacletheater.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/srlbanner-4.jpg=

FRIDAY, MAY 210:00 PM
THURSDAY, MAY 27:30 PM
TUESDAY, MAY 310:00 PM
@ Spectacle=20
theater http://www.spectacletheater.com/404-future-not-found-cyberworlds-an=
d-terminal-cases/

For over three decades, Survival Research Labs has awed and intimidated=20
with large-scale, fantastically destructive mechanized performance art.=20
Founded in 1978 by Mark Pauline and joined by a larger organization of=20
engineers, technicians, and artists, SRL literally built a world with=20
humanity marginalized as fragile spectator, completely irrelevant to the=20
chaotic industrial maelstrom at hand. Brutal is incorrecinhuman=
 is the=20
exact worthese events feature machines turned performers, compl=
etely=20
freed from practical use. Names like Flame Hurricane, Shockwave Cannon,=20
Hand O God, Big Arm, and Mr. Satan undersell the intense workmanship and=20
severe destructive capabilities behind each creatiooften utiliz=
ing=20
sketchily-sourced military-grade parts, these machines are elegant and=20
pragmatic in their operation. Unlike todaeveryday appliances, d=
esigned=20
to be physically inaccessible to the user, SRrobots are marvels=
 of=20
hand-built efficient futility.


Spectacle is very proud to present a sampler of SRover-30 years=
 and 50=20
shows of work, each a general dedication to the idea of more is more, with=
=20
apolitical agenda and displays of terrifying power. Things comes full=20
circle with L.A. MOC2011 installation; featuring the De-Manufac=
turing=20
Machine from SRfirst show MACHINE SEX, then sprung on an unsusp=
ecting=20
audience at a commandeered gas station, now in a comfortable institutional=
=20
setting destroying electronic-organic creations (including a crawling baby=
=20
doll fitted inside a raw chicken), nothing could more perfectly sum up=20
SRhistory of creation and subversion than well-heeled museum pa=
trons=20
attentively waiting to be splattered by guts and wires. SRL continues=2roducing the most dangerous shows on eart.

With selections from:


A BITTER MESSAGE OF HOPELESS GRIEF
Dir. Jon Reiss, 1987

EXTREMELY CRUEL PRACTICES: A SERIES OF EVENTS DESIGNED TO INSTRUCT THOSE=20
INTERESTED IN POLICIES THAT CORRECT OR PUNISH
Dir. Jon Reiss, 1985

AREA NIGHTCLUB SHOW NYC
Ed. Jon Reiss, 1985

CRIMEWAVE SHOW
Dir. Dave Scardina, 1995

DANGEROUS CURVES
Dir. Dave Scardina, 2005

SURVIVAL RESEARCH LABS AT L.A. MOCA
Ed. Allan Kelley, 2011

THE DOOM SHOW
Dir. Leslie Asako Gladsjo, 1994

From: "Yuan Gao" <yg1349@nyu.edu>
To: "Nicholas Bratton" <nick.bratton@nyu.edu>
Subject: Re: DigitalOcean plan
Nick,

I'm currently storing each record in the db as one table of (file id, tag, =
probability), and today I'm going to create a 2nd table of (filename, md5, =
filepath in the os) to account for the fact that some files might get modif=
ied or deleted to keep the db in sync.

As for retrieval, currently I think as long as we have enough images (hence=
 tags), we are guaranteed to get similar results based on matching tags alo=
ne. I'm researching on ways to match images based not only on exact tag-mat=
ching, but also semantically silimar tags
I'm on a plane right now going to LA. I'll get the db ready by tonight. Cou=
ld you do me a favor by telling Laura that we need to subscribe to Clarifai=
 for $20/month? Because we need to get around the 5000 units/month and 1000=
 units/hour limit.

Thanks a lot.

Yuan

From: Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu>
To: YUCHI MA <mayuchibruce@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: Viacom fellowship
We possess the essential technical skills for producing VR contents, e.g.
3D modeling, 3D rendering, JavaScript/C# programming, etc.

We have past experience with hardware and software such as Oculus Rift,
Gear VR, Unity/Unreal, Maya, and Vuforia.



We will be actively exploring new contexts to embed our skills and past
experience in, focusing on creating novel narratives and pushing forward
the existing boundary of VR experience in a more experimental direction.

We will also try to investigate and develop new ways for VR experiences to
involve multiple users and for the experiences to render and unfold in real
time.

We also consider combining VR experience with the most accessible
interfaces like browsers and mobile devices, by e.g. using the latest
specifications in WebVR, and strive to expand and enhance the Web contents
with the enabling power of VR.




We have demo-ed one VR project in the VR lab, which is about gesture
control in VR, using android wears to recognize gestures by detecting the
orientations. People from and outside of ITP (Interactive Telecommunication
Program) in NYU have tried our demos, including developers, engineers,
artists, designers, professors, as well as some friends of ours that wasn't
familiar with the technology back then.




VR for us not only means a new standard of 360-degree medium format, but
also a future platform for social communication, content sharing, and
co-operation and connection between people. We believe that a
function-oriented switching between the virtual and the real world can help
people deal with limited time and space problems. We've been interested in
and devoting to developing VR-related concepts and projects for over 1 year.




Job Simulator resonates with us a lot, but not exactly what we intend to
achieve. This example involves an input interface that increases the
interaction between human and device.

Many VR projects or technology nowadays are focusing on virtual experience
for a single user who is receiving the content in a more passive way. What
we are interested in more is to let multiple users actively interact with
each others through VR. An inspiring example is Ken Perlin's Holojam. We
believe that VR devices connecting users with each other generate more
value, especially through the Web or peer-to-peer communication in the
future. URL for HoloJam
https://virtualrealityreporter.com/holojam-demo-siggraph-2015-by-nyu-researcher-ken-perlin/




The VR content we are hoping to deliver to the audience is a demo
experience in which people can play with different musical instruments
(imagine virtual synthesizers, drum machines, and turntables alike...),
following a pre-programmed guide and real-time instructions to perform a
virtual music jamming, in a space whose backdrop, aesthetic setting, and
scale are otherwise nearly impossible to construct in the real world.

We hope that our audience will consider wanting to participate in, as
audience or musicians, a music concert of the future that happens purely in
VR. We'd also like them to think that VR is not something alien to our
existing world, not as a simulacrum or gamified environment, but something
that has the potential to elevate our existing experience to a higher realm.




We are hoping that Viacom, with its ongoing ventures and experience in
delivering VR contents, will help us greatly with setting up a
state-of-the-art environment that is both mature for development and
production, as well as help us refine our ideas and strategies in the
process.

On Sun, Apr 10, 2016 at 6:49 PM, YUCHI MA <mayuchibruce@gmail.com> wrote:

> Where have you demo-ed your VR projects? What types of audiences have
> tried your VR projects? *
> We have demo-ed one VR project in VR lab, which is about gesture
> controller in VR, using android wears detecting the orientations to
> recognise gestures. People from ITP (interactive telecommunication program)
> NYU have experienced our demos, including developers, engineers, artists,
> designers, professors, and also some people not familiar with technology,
> friends of ours.
>
> What does VR mean to you? When did you become interested in VR? Why are
> you interested in it as a medium for new media experiences? *
> VR for us not only means another new-standard 360 degree medium format,
> but also a future platform for social communication, sharing, cooperating
> and connection bridges for people. We think functionally oriented switching
> between virtual and reality can help people deal with time and space
> problems. We've interested and been devoting to developing VR related
> concepts and projects for over 1 year.
>
> Watch and consider the VR experience examples above and tell us, in a few
> sentences, which one resonated with you most and why? If you would like to
> provide a link to another VR experience that resonates with you, please do
> so and indicate why. *
> Job Simulator resonates us a lot, but not exactly what we want to achieve.
> This example involves inputs and outputs within interface, which increases
> the interaction between human and device. Nowadays, VR projects or
> technology are focusing on virtual experience for just one user who is
> receiving what providers offer. But what we interested more is let multiple
> users interact with each others through VR. Another inspiring example is
> Ken Perlin's Holojam. We believe VR devices connecting each other will
> generate more value, especially through the networks or one one one
> communication. URL for HoloJam
> https://virtualrealityreporter.com/holojam-demo-siggraph-2015-by-nyu-researcher-ken-perlin/
> .
>

From: Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu>
To: Midori L Yasuda <midori.yasuda@nyu.edu>
Subject: Inquiry about possible scholarship/grant
Hello Midori,

This is Yuan from the first year. After two fulfilling semesters of study
in ITP, I had stumbled across some financial problem myself, and I'm
writing to you to seek for possible alleviation of my situation:

As we all know the tuition for ITP is not on the cheap side. Before I came
to ITP I had a full-time job so I was doing ok. However, due to my status
as an alien resident I had to give up my job to join ITP as a full-time
student. After two semesters and being recently married, I'm gradually
feeling the financial burden on me and my family. Right now I'm trying to
seek any possible scholarship/grant out there to ease my burden, and I
think it's reasonable to start with ITP first.

I'd be grateful if you could help me find out if there's any prospect of a
scholarship/grant from ITP/NYU for the next two semesters, or even just the
next? I'd be happy to provide materials for any kind of application.


Best,
Yuan Gao (yg1349)

From: Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu>
To: Amit Friedberg <amitos80@gmail.com>
Subject: Re: Schedule this week
Amit,

That sounds very fun. I'm definitely interested. When would they need your
demo? Have you found a way to register the peeing event? Anyways, I'm
greatly interested and would like to know what needs to be done and how I
can contribute.

On Tuesday, March 15, 2016, Amit Friedberg <amitos80@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hi Yuan,
>
> Few weeks ago the Tribeca Film Institute published a post about looking
> for new media artist for making the whole building interactive for this
> year's Interactive Playground. I proposed a the following idea for the
> toilet:
> A toilet that will play music only while the user is
> peeing, beginning when the pee hits the water and ending when it stops. For
> example, I was thinking about playing the classical *Typewriter* piece
> (can be found here) because the structure of this piece is closely synced
> with the pace of peeing. The experience allows the user to perform as if
> conducting an orchestra, but instead of dictating the rhythm using
> classical hand gestures the user simply has to pee.
>
> They loved it and asked for a demo I'm building these days and looking for
> someone to collaborate on this as there is enough work for more than one
> person.
> Will you be interested in taking part?
> Best,
> Amit
>
> On Mon, Mar 14, 2016 at 10:56 PM, Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu

>>>> Hi Yuan,
>>>>
>>>> Few weeks ago the Tribeca Film Institute published a post about
>>>> looking for new media artist for making the whole building interactive for
>>>> this year's Interactive Playground. I proposed a the following idea for the
>>>> toilet:
>>>> A toilet that will play music only while the user is
>>>> peeing, beginning when the pee hits the water and ending when it stops. For
>>>> example, I was thinking about playing the classical *Typewriter* piece
>>>> (can be found here) because the structure of this piece is closely synced
>>>> with the pace of peeing. The experience allows the user to perform as
>>>> if conducting an orchestra, but instead of dictating the rhythm using
>>>> classical hand gestures the user simply has to pee.
>>>>
>>>> They loved it and asked for a demo I'm building these days and looking
>>>> for someone to collaborate on this as there is enough work for more than
>>>> one person.
>>>> Will you be interested in taking part?
>>>> Best,
>>>> Amit
>>>>

Subject: Re: openframeworks - Obtain ofImage from vector<ofPoint> returned by ofPolyline::getVertices()?
Thanks Kyle!

On Friday, April 15, 2016, Kyle McDonald <kyle@kylemcdonald.net> wrote:

> You're going to want to use the getBoundingBoxmethod of ofPolyline, then
> use the crop method of ofImage using the bounding box as your region.
>
> On Friday, April 15, 2016, <yg1349@nyu.edu
> <javascript:_e(%7B%7D,'cvml','yg1349@nyu.edu');>> wrote:
>
>> Hi list,
>>
>> Does anyone know the most efficient way to get an ofImage from a vector
>> of ofPoints returned by calling ofPolyline::getVertices()?
>>
>> Take the code from the "example-empty" of ofxFaceTracker for example:
>>
>>   ofPolyline noseBase = tracker.getImageFeature(ofxFaceTracker::NOSE_BASE
>> );
>>
>>   ofSetColor(ofColor::red);
>>
>>   noseBase.draw();
>>
>>   ofDrawCircle(noseBase.getCentroid2D(), 8 * tracker.getScale());
>>
>>   std::vector<ofPoint> points = noseBase.getVertices(); // get points
>>
>>   // ... crop an ofImage from vector<ofPoint> ???
>>
>>
>>     ofImage image = ???
>>
>> What's should the missing part be like?
>>
>> Thanks.
>>

From: Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu>
To: felix@enertiv.com
Subject: student from NYU ITP seeking summer internship opportunity
Hello Felix,

My name is Yuan Gao, currently a first-year student in NYU ITP. I got your
email from a great guy named John Farrell in ITP, who has given us a
workshop on Enertiv and encouraged us to do projects with it. So I did a
project with the Enertiv data of ITP for my Energy class this semester
(taught by Jeff Feddersen), and I've just presented it yesterday in the
final class.

I've heard from John that Enertiv is probably looking for some interns, so
I took the liberty of applying for such a position with you (if such
openings do exist). In case you're interested in seeing what I did with the
Enertiv system, it's called

Forecasting Electric Energy Consumption of ITP Using Enertiv Energy
Monitoring System and Support Vector Machine for Regress

(sorry for the title) and here's the slides I've presented with in my class:

https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1BDYve_cUuWzEdBpQBzAjwJcrT6Hq7yCSG8uuRjpp8MY/edit?usp=sharing

also the code for this project can be found here:
https://github.com/821760408-sp/itp-energy-forecast-with-enertiv

my resume can be seen on my portfolio website: www.ko-yuen.com/resume

I'm looking forward to hearing from you.


Best,

Yuan

LaurOn Oct 12, 2016, at 12:00 PM, Lauren Taylor <laurenamandataylor=40gmail.c=
om> wrote:

Hi Nic
Thanks for sharing the below. We went through and agree that number 1, a =
web crawler, seems like a more likely fit and higher advantages for us.=C2=
=A0

However, we are curious to see what your research will show on both conce=
pts, and all sounds good to move forward on your ideas
ThanksLauren and Laura

On Tue, Oct 11, 2016 at 11:03 AM, Nicholas Bratton <nick.bratton=40nyu.ed=
u> wrote:
Looking forward to hearing about the meeting with Marta. Until then, I'd =
be curious to look into the app you mentioned -- if either you or Lauren =
remember it let me know. In any case, we will show the images in the caro=
usel -- not just the links. How do we get them=3F That's something I'm re=
searching this week as there seem to be a few options:

1. Use a web crawler to visit, index, and store online content (the way s=
earch engines index the internet) and then serve files (images) according=
 to our retrieval algorithm. The process here would be to index images wh=
en a page is visited by the crawler, run our image segmentation and compu=
ter vision algorithms on it, save the correlated results in a database, a=
nd serve these images when their properties (a.k.a. tags) are called on b=
y future client requests. The fun part comes in when we start to also con=
sider metadata, e.g.:

---who is the user (3rd party cookies, for example)
---who is the user (linked social media)
---from where are they accessing Sift-It and what other sites have they v=
isited
---did they input preferences into their Sift-It settings

and when we consider that, as a platform, we have the ability to tailor t=
he weighting of the images in our 'database' of images, e.g.:

---we can decide to preferentially show images from certain places online=


2. Utilize established search engines (this frees up time and resources f=
or us, but won't be sustainable over the long-term I think) to retrieve n=
ew content for the user. Here what Sift-It offers would seemingly be simp=
ly doing the searching for a user -- which is to say, doing keyword searc=
hes (where the keywords are generated from our image analysis) in pre-exi=
sting databases. The disadvantage here is that we'd be limited to the ima=
ge databases and link hierarchies set in place by other corporations. One=
 way around it would be to set up a search engine aggregator but I think =
this method would be computationally intensive, and maybe a hindrance to =
creating a unique, financially independent platform.

-----

I will continue to research this and Yuan and I can start writing code so=
on to test things out. Will keep you posted if all sounds good
N

On Mon, Oct 10, 2016 at 7:36 PM, laura lehmann <lehmannlaura=40mac.com> w=
rote:
Hi Nick,

I just left the meeting with Marta at Lehmann Maupin, I will update you o=
n what we discussed next time we spea
I started thinking about user examples and thought about something. If we=
 were using Sift-it on a carousel on lehmannmaupin.com that started of wi=
th the work of an artist, and then based on the user interaction, the nex=
t most relevant image was on that artisinstagram account, how=
 could that image be integrated into the sift-it platform=3F Is sift-it a=
ctually scanning the entire web (kind of like google) and then recognizin=
g that image or do some parameters have to be set around the image cloud =
first=3F also how is that image then replicated into the carousel=3F or i=
s it just linked=3F I think Lauren and I had found an app that solved thi=
s but I cannot remember iname no
We can clarify this over the next few days, I just realized we never went=
 into the mechanism of all of this today=21

thanks,

Laura

From: Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu>
To: yg1349@nyu.edu
Subject: Question on @Quora: What do you actually plot in order to get
 this image in neural network?
Question on @Quora: What do you actually plot in order to get this image in neural network?


https://www.quora.com/What-do-you-actually-plot-in-order-to-get-this-image-in-neural-network?srid=5b5G&share=c1a047fe

From: Dante DelGiacco <dante.delgiacco@nyu.edu>
Date: Tue, Nov 15, 2016 at 2:31 PM
Subject: [ITP Announce: 2015] Re: Important Information RE: Part-Time
Status for 2nd Years
To: <announce@itp.nyu.edu>


Dear Students,

As a follow-up to my previous email, please read this important note about
Full-Time Equivalency and Financial Aid (specifically *scholarships*):

Equivalency is used to help students retain their eligibility for loans,
but it does not make a student eligible for scholarships. Scholarship
funding can be used ONLY to cover the actual cost of tuition generated by
enrollment in courses, that is, the actual number of units for which a
student is enrolled.

Please consult the Office of Financial Aid at 212-998-4444
<(212)%20998-4444> for more information if you have any concerns about how
going part-time, with full-time equivalency status in your final semester
will affect your financial aid package.


Best,

Dante DelGiacco
Department Administrator
Interactive Telecommunications Program (ITP)
Tisch School of the Arts
New York University
721 Broadway, 4th Floor
New York NY 10003
Phone: (212) 998-1881 <%28212%29%20998-1882>
Fax: (212) 998-1898
dante.delgiacco@nyu.edu <midori.yasuda@nyu.edu>
http://tisch.nyu.edu/itp

On Tue, Nov 15, 2016 at 1:00 PM, Dante DelGiacco <dante.delgiacco@nyu.edu>
wrote:

Dear Second Year Students,

If you are planning on going part-time during Spring 2017 and you are
receiving financial aid, have loans, or are an international student on a
visa that requires you to be full-time, *you will need to bring me a
completed Full-Time Equivalency Form.*

*The form, along with some very helpful information (including a breakdown
of the costs of going full-time versus part-time) can be found on this page
on the ITP Help site: *
*https://sites.google.com/a/itp.nyu.edu/help/curriculum/fulltime?pli=1
<https://sites.google.com/a/itp.nyu.edu/help/curriculum/fulltime?pli=1>*

First-years, take note that if you are planning on going part-time next
Spring, you want to take 18 credits in at least one semester as taking 16,
16, and 16 credits in your first three semesters will leave you with 12
credits to take in your final semester, and that is where the full-time
charge kicks in.

If you have any questions about part-time status, full-time equivalency, or
tuition and fee cost breakdowns - please email or visit me at the front
desk and I will be happy to help.

Best,

Dante DelGiacco
Department Administrator
Interactive Telecommunications Program (ITP)
Tisch School of the Arts
New York University
721 Broadway, 4th Floor
New York NY 10003
Phone: (212) 998-1881 <%28212%29%20998-1882>
Fax: (212) 998-1898
dante.delgiacco@nyu.edu <midori.yasuda@nyu.edu>
http://tisch.nyu.edu/itp

Subject: Re: Chat?
ON ACCESSING CLARIFAI API:

This is the main program used to access Clarifai:

https://github.com/Sift-It-proto/clarifai-python
https://github.com/Sift-It-proto/clarifai-python
https://polymail.io/?utm_source=3Dpolymail&utm_medium=3Dreferral&utm_campai=
gn=3Dlink-preview

https://github.com/Sift-It-proto/clarifai-python

https://github.com/Sift-It-proto/clarifai-python

To use their API, yoneed the client id and secret for this proj=
ect I created on Clarifai.com:

Client ID

ytmIhyHIA8xWh5JPfrUZVrSJXrF3tFDHhwNvbLT

Client Secret

1s5MDKIfHvpcZZcZsrSMBU2AtJjFbNXGnF4VE5S

The installation is not much different from whain the README, e=
xcept that you need to install the

Pillow

package, and, if you wanna do database connection, the

mysql.connector

package

To tag/label a single image, yoonly need to run

./main.py <input_file>

; to tag multiple images in a folder, you need to run

./main.py -b <batch_size> <input_folder>

to specify how many images you want to send each batch, because Clarifai ha=
s a restriction of 128 images you can send at one time. The

potential pitfall

is that right now hardcoding the output file path, so you need =
to move the JSON response somewhere else manually before sending another re=
quest, so that the previous result doget overwritte(=
l fix this later)

Thabasically it! Let me know if you have any suggestions.

On Thu, Oct 20, 2016 at 3:49 PM Nicholas Bratton

<
mailto:Nicholas Bratton <nick.bratton@nyu.edu>
> wrote:

a, pre, code, a:link, body { word-wrap: break-word !important; }

Check out this Processing sketch when you get the chance. It was a quick wa=
y to prototype the hover feature. Try hovering over different objects (if y=
ou click and, for now, hold you'll get a popup)
Check out the data folder. There are multiple images for each of the segmen=
ts. The segmented images have transparent backgrounds. What I am thinking i=
s to send each of these to clarifai to be tagged so that we have unique tag=
s that are absolutely correlated with features (selectable sub-images) in t=
he image. Talk more on the phone.

From: Yuan Gao <yg1349@nyu.edu>
To: liveweb-fall2016 <liveweb-fall2016@itp.nyu.edu>
Subject: [liveweb-spring2016] [Electron] building native Node modules
If you're planning to build Electron apps this issue with building native Node modules for Electron might concern you, especially when your encounter an error of not finding some modules in some paths.

https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/tutorial/using-native-node-modules.md

ession 2016 in Brooklyn last November.

a, pre, code, a:link, body { word-wrap: break-word !important; }

[Winter Show 2016 Production Announcement No. 5
Reminder: Floor Breakdown is at 8PM After CommLab Screening!!!

What this means:

We need your help - so stay to lend a hand, even if it's cleaning up and re=
moving your old projects, the stuff you thought you had hidden behind or on=
 top of some locker or cabinet!

Everything not related to the Show should be off the floor with the close o=
f classes today!

If you had development or staging space you should already be cleaned up, o=
rganized and on hand to move your project to your Show location once the fu=
rnishings have been stored

If you can't help, OK, but the Floor will close from 8PM - 10PM while we di=
smantle everything and put things into storage so you'll have to excuse you=
rself

The Equipment Room is officially CLOSEDThe Mandatory Equipment and =
Space Checkin is tomorrow from 11AM - 4PM

We will allow On-Floor ONLY checkouts this evening but all equipment is due=
 back by the close of the dayYou may hold onto any embedded tech in=
 your project, but you should return monitors, projectors, Kinects, webcams=
, etc tonight so that we dispense everything for the Show tomorrowY=
ou may label that which you have been working with - there is painter's tap=
e in the ER

We will meet in the Lounge at 8PM after the Screening!

THANKS!!!

Rob, Tom and Gabe

NY

TSO

he bottom of the document. This is the order we will use for the dress rehe=
arsal tomorrow night. It also has your buddy.

on stage lets practice that

From: None
To: None
Subject: None
'''
For all who's interested in using OpenCV for their Node.js projects.
'''

Came across this issue when I switched to a different laptop and tried to 
install the Node.js OpenCV binding node-opencv 
<https://github.com/peterbraden/node-opencv> there. 

After running

npm install -S opencv

from command line, the installation stopped at this error "ld: library not 
found for -llibtbb.dylib".

I googled the error and there hasn't been a consensus on how to solve this 
problem. After three hours grappling with all sorts of hacks I think I've 
found the "most definitive" solution so I'd like to share it here:

If you come across this exact same error, try the following steps in your 
terminal:

1, First make sure you have OpenCV installed in your computer. If you're 
using Mac OS and Homebrew, run

brew info opencv

to check. You must install opencv with the --with-tbb flag, i.e.

brew install opencv --with-tbb

2, Also make sure you have tbb and pkg-config installed. Using homebrew:

brew install tbb pkg-config

3, Make sure you have node-gyp <https://github.com/nodejs/node-gyp> 
installed globally, i.e.

npm install -g node-gyp

4, Right now you should have a file called libtbb.dylib under 
/usr/local/lib. You may run 

[ -f /usr/local/lib/libtbb.dylib ] && echo "exists"

to make sure. 

5, You should also have a file called opencv.pc under 
/usr/local/lib/pkgconfig. 

-f /usr/local/lib/pkgconfig/opencv.pc ] && echo "exists"

You may open it in your favorite text editor, e.g. Sublime Text, to edit 
it. Find the flag that says "-llibtbb.dylib" and replace it with 
'/usr/local/lib/libtbb.dylib". Save and close.

6, IMPORTANT. Run

brew uninstall opencv

to uninstall opencv from your computer, then run

brew install opencv --with-tbb

to install again. You should now be able to run

npm install opencv

to install node-opencv without the error in the title!!!!




-- 
You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "liveweb-fall2016" group.
To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to liveweb-fall2016+unsubscribe@itp.nyu.edu.

Visit this group at https://groups.google.com/a/itp.nyu.edu/group/liveweb-fall2016/.
To view this discussion on the web visit https://groups.google.com/a/itp.nyu.edu/d/msgid/liveweb-fall2016/6becbdea-77ce-45e9-ad5f-54c0bcd8fa19%40itp.nyu.edu.

From: Allan Tucker <
mailto:tucker@foothilldigital.com
>

Date: Mon, Feb 06, 2017 at 6:50 PM

Subject: Mastering -- Helpful hints

To: foat-gmail <
mailto:foat-gmail%20<forallotherthings@gmail.com>
>

a, pre, code, a:link, body { word-wrap: break-word !important; }

Mastering Mavens,

Some thoughts:

1.

Anyone with FTP, Cyberduck, Fetch, WeTransfer, or other

file transfer

issues -- please bring your questions to class Wednesday.

2.

Here's a review of some key

soundBlade

stuffA. Selection

is the area that turns yellow when you click and drag across a section of a=
n EDLB. In and Out point[ are used to designate material you wish to edit, where [ i=
s the first sample and ] is the last. These are used to add, move or delete=
 material in a master. They are used in 2, 3 or 4-point versions, depending=
 on whether you want to Replace something in the Destination (and keep the =
overall running time as-is), or Insert something (which may change the over=
all time)
C. SRP

(Selection Reference Points) are the small yellow triangles that are placed=
 anywhere along the bottom of an EDL. Useful to ID verses, choruses, proble=
ms, potential edit spots -- anything you want to indicate. They can contain=
 text if you want. Double-click any SRP
D.

A

segment

is the portion of a waveform between two crossfades

. Every song starts out as a single segment. If you were to delete a chorus=
, the screen would now show 2 segments. It is still a single original sourc=
e file; just divided into x number of parts in the EDL. Creating a segment =
is how a portion of a song can be isolated for gain change, for example
E. M

enu

commands showing a

hotkey

are hard wired into the system. Anything without a hotkey requires a

QuicKeys

macro. If you want to use QKeys, do the basic installation from the zQuicKe=
ys folder I gave you in Folder 01. Be sure to read the

ReadMe

file. I'll configure it for you in class, and you'll have a lot more speed =
and flexibility
F.

To do a

Record (Capture)

, have an EDL in a Project's top position as Destination. Arm the EDL for r=
ecording by Option-clicking on its

R

button at the left side of the EDL. Open the

New Soundfile Prefs

widget to designate a

Path

for the capture, and also give the capture file a

N

ame

. Then a

Wild capture

can be started from wherever you click in the EDL by clicking on the green =
LED in the top Transport section of a Project. Stop the capture with the

spacebar

.

A variant of a wild capture is the

SRP capture

, in which sBlade records the time exactly between a pair of SRPs. Double-c=
lick in the space between two SRPs to Select the area; then click on the gr=
een LED as in a wild record. The system will stop itself at the final SRP. =
If you want to record from one SRP to another that has other SRPs in betwee=
n,

then click on the first SRP and SHIFT-CLICK on the final SRP

. That selects the entire area between them(Hint:

LOCK all SRPs in the track to keep the SRP from disappearing when the captu=
re file automatically places itself into the EDL when finished

.)

If you want the most efficient and satisfying result from your Mastering ef=
forts this term, then go ahead and try

QuicKeys

(see Item

E

above)Do the basic installation. Ask me to assist and configure it.=
 Try to arrive in Dolan early if you can.

Thanks all!

at

ze-adjust: none; font-weight: 400; } .ReadMsgBody{ width: 100%; } .External=
Class{ width: 100%; } img { border: 0; max-width: 100%; height: auto; outli=
ne: none; display: inline-block; margin: 0; padding: 0; text-decoration: no=
ne; line-height: 100%; } #backgroundTable{ height: 100% !important; margin:=
 0; padding: 0; width: 100% !important; }

/** * Generic */ .main { font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; letter-=
spacing: 0; width: 100%; } table { border-spacing: 0; border-collapse: sepa=
rate; table-layout: fixed; } td { padding: 0; font-family: Helvetica, Arial=

Subject: Re: Meeting on Wed.
Hi Nick,

I've uploaded every piece of code to our Github repo and our server.
THere's also a .sh file indicating how the code should be run.

If you're writing the final report to Laura, could you add that with our
prototype, it is now possible to, in real time, analyze images by tags and
colors, store this information into the database, and retrieve relevant
images from the database through matching tags and colors by variable
criteria. Thus we have completed a useful prototype for further development
in the future.

Please let me know (just generally) how you're planning to wrap it up~


Best,
Yuan

From: None
To: None
Subject: None
Everyone,

If your DigitalOcean droplet, like mine, has only a *meager* memory size of 
512MB, you might once in a while find your *npm install* command gets 
killed by the system, especially when the dependencies being installed are 
many, leaving nothing under the folder /node_modules/.bin, which means 
module installation has failed. In that case, adding a "swapfile" to your 
system might come to your rescue.

This article 
<https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-add-swap-on-ubuntu-14-04#tweak-your-swap-settings> 
explains the steps of creating swapfile in great detail. 

Cheers.

-- 
You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "liveweb-fall2016" group.
To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to liveweb-fall2016+unsubscribe@itp.nyu.edu.

On Wed, Feb 08, 2017 at 1:23 AM Ross Goodwin

<
mailto:Ross Goodwin <ross.goodwin@gmail.com>
> wrote:

a, pre, code, a:link, body { word-wrap: break-word !important; }

Hey Yuan,

I did use HPC. My advice would be to read all the guides on the
https://wikis.nyu.edu/display/NYUHPC/High+Performance+Computing+at+NYU
, which is what I did. There's a bit of a learning curve, but you should be=
 able to figure it out pretty fast if you're familiar with Linux environmen=
ts.

Can't really give too much more general advice than that, because I'm not s=
ure exactly what you're trying to do. Let me know if you have any specific =
questions.

Ross
